Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: WtoCtoTO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night of a wedding we attended and were very pleased. This is one of the nicest hotels in Toronto and is a great location. The service is very friendly, professional and discrete. Though we weren't there to be tourists, this would be an ideal hotel for any purpose - tourists, business, or any other reason. Our room was a suite with a separate living room. It was very clean and the bed was great. We didn't arrive until after 1am and then were supposed to check out at 11am, but realized we didn't get a chance to really enjoy the room. So we booked for an extra night. Yorkville is a great area to stay and since you are near the subway you can get anywhere else downtown. There's a Whole Foods across the street so we picked up lunch and brought it back to our room. We spent the afternoon at the Stillwater spa in the hotel and it was fantastic. As we were about to leave the hotel to find a place to eat for dinner, in the elevator there was a delivery person with some great smelling Indian food being delivered to the hotel, so we asked what it was. The delivery person told us it was from a healthy Indian takeout place in Yorkville called Veda Healthy Indian Takeout. We love Indian food, so when we heard it was healthy we decided instead of calling for delivery to enjoy a short walk through Yorkville to Yonge Street about 5-10 minutes (2-3 blocks) away at Yorkville Avenue. We really enjoyed the food from Veda with some wine that we ordered through room service and had the hotel bring up to our room. It was nice to just relax in our big comfortable suite with good healthy Indian food and a great bottle of wine. After dinner we enjoyed a nice drink at the rooftop bar. It was a nice atmosphere but pretty quiet the night we were there. We've been to several weddings at this hotel before and have always enjoyed the service and quality. There are other nice hotels in the area and it can be a bit pricey, but it is well worth it. Park Hyatt is a good quality brand that we know we can trust to always be consistent. We would definitely recommend this hotel if your company is paying or you want to splurge to be guaranteed good service.

Reviews.Title: “Stay with style”
Reviews.Author: VfB 1893
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old, really old - but you know what? Thats the good thing about it. It has style. Style you dont find in a boring Novotel or standard Marriott. I was awarded a nice room on the 12th floor with nice ipod connecting devices and up to date technology. However the room and the entire hotel needs refurbishment, that is for sure, but you can see how much details have been put into furniture, amnieties, bedlinen, etc. I received an upgrade and truly enjoyed the stay, even though things are dated. Breakfast is excellent. Really worth the money and the staff is very corteous. Bell boy and reception also excellent. Valet parking is a little pricey, but i did not find any space to park... I was a little disappointed with the rooftop bar - I really do not know what is so special about it. The views and bars in Hong Kong, San Francisco, Chicago, Dusseldorf, Singapore, etc. are dozen times better...however it didnt make me think less of the hotel. I would stay again, but if the 4 season opens brand new it might get hard to decide.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome slice of luxury amidst the Bloor Street retail scene”
Reviews.Author: DavidatTarget
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel with top notch service and great rooms. I stayed here for business for one night and loved my stay. The hotel is located away from the bustle of King & Queen Streets, but is well-placed in the glitter of Bloor's shopping district. My room (on the 8th floor of the north tower facing north) was very nice, particularly the large bathroom that wide enough to spread my arms out and not touch a wall and bergamot toiletries; the room was very well-planned with the mini-bar tucked inconspicuously into a corner and for once, an open electrical outlet that was not randomly placed in the entry hall or behind the bureau. Additionally, the service was exceptional. Coming home after dinner and cocktails, I was pleased to find that the room had been tidied up for me to go to bed. We also had excellent service at the rooftop bar.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Yorkville Hotel - but THIN walls.”
Reviews.Author: DerekToronto5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hyatt Toronto for one night this past weekend. The lobby is quite beautiful and the staff was very nice. While not a modern hotel, it's clear that the hotel is an upper-end property. The location is great and from what I've hear their spa is very nice too. Our room was in the north tower and was very clean. The furnishings were nice but not over the top - then again we were in a standard room. The bed in the room was very comfortable but unfortunately the walls are very thin. Our neighbors were up to about 2am partying and it’s like we were in the room with them – but not having any of the fun. In retrospect I should have called the front desk to ask for them to assist but we were so tired all we wanted to do was sleep. The good news is when they finally did end the party we had a great rest.

Reviews.Title: “standout spa”
Reviews.Author: jkb08
Reviews.Content: A friend and I made an annual trip to TO and the Park Hyatt for 6 years running until we had a less than satisfactory time the 6th time around. We went elsewhere last year and decided to give it another go in 2012. It was worth it. I agree with others that the lack of in-room coffee, unavailability of the house car and lack of soundproofing are somewhat disappointing, but the service was very professional and the spa was, once again, simply outstanding. We found the experience to be very hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: Matt K
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not live up to its four star rating in most categories, namely service. The valet was quick and professional, however at $40 it should have been. When we entered the room the ice bucket was full of half melted ice. I called down to ask for more, then called down twice more, finally going down to the desk after an hour of no one coming up with anything. While talking with the front desk about what the problem was the doorman commented they were only at 37% occupancy. How a four star hotel has trouble with something simple like this while not even busy is troubling. This was a sign of things to come as on two different occasions we were told that the house car was not available for us to use, the first time the driver was about to get off of his shift, and the second time we were informed that it only ran from 6pm-10pm on a Saturday. The hotel lobby is very nice as is the driveway up to the hotel and the corridors to the room. The room itself was okay, however nothing besides perhaps a deep seated tub and 3 pieces of art differentiated this hotel from a Sheraton or a holiday inn. We stayed in a deluxe double room which was not worth the up charge for a small sitting area. We were all unimpressed for what the hotel presented on the website vs what we experienced. Definitely not worth the money we paid, we traveled to the Hyatt regency in Toronto also, which we found nicer for a better price. The money paid for the room is not an issue, however the value for the price paid was just not there. Would not stay again and would advise other travelers to check out other luxury hotels in Toronto. The new Four Seasons is opening soon, and I'm sure they would love to take Hyatts castoffs.

Reviews.Title: “Expected better”
Reviews.Author: Arcaneind
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Park Hyatt Toronto for an overnight associated to an event in down town Toronto. As this hotel wasn't the destination, I cannot comment on this hotel except for valet parking, reception and the room itself. Valet parking was quick and service was very professional. The lobby was nicely appointed and up-scale. The check-in was fast and service was average. The room was in the north tower and was nice. Been in better, but definitely more better appointed than a run-of-the-mill hotel. Bed was comfortable. Bathroom was dated and wallpaper was even starting to peal at the edges; needed an updated. My main complaint was for an expensive hotel I could not believe how poor the sound-proofing was. We were near the elevator and could hear everything, all the time. I actually looked once to check if we had forgotten to shut the door! This is a relatively easy thing to fix with proper doors and transom seal. Anyway, It wasn't worth the money in my opinion as there isn't enough to differentiate it from lower-price chains.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch!! No Complaints, Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: w0rldtraveller2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days, and have to say that it is the Top 3 of hotels in Toronto. There is some new competition between Trump, Ritz, and Four Seasons, but location is tops, the design is timeless, and complimentary car is great. I stayed in the North Tower, that is more modern than the traditional South tower, and prefer it, as it is a bit more relaxed, though a bit more of a hike than than south to the main Lobby. Also I have to say that the Breakfast in the main restaurant is excellent, and the spa is beautiful and fully featured. It is currently the best hotel, but as I have not stayed at the Ritz yet (Financiall District) and really love the Yorkville area.

Reviews.Title: “A New Annual Tradition”
Reviews.Author: madrews
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have made a tradition of heading to Toronto's "Miracle Mile" for the Boxing Day sales on December 26th. This year we decided to get a room at the Park Hyatt Toronto for two nights as it was close to our shopping destinations and they offered excellent room deals. Having enjoyed both nights immensely, we now know that we must include a stay at this hotel be included in our annual tradition. My sister and her three daughters joined us for one night and they too want to make this an annual event. The rooms were large, and extremely comfortable. The staff could not have been more pleasant, from the doormen, to front desk personnel, to the housekeeping coming to perform nightly turn-down service. My ONLY complaint with the hotel was the lack of coffee machines/kettles in the rooms. This is the only hotel I have experienced in years that does not have this available. While I understand that the hotel offers 24 hour service, you do necessarily want to have to answer your door and/or wait for a cup of tea. This will necessitate my bringing my own immerser/travel kettle with me. I do hope they change their policy on this issue before my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “First class, all the way”
Reviews.Author: sbklaj
Reviews.Content: We think this is a great hotel because of its location and because the staff were very friendly and courteous. Our room had a very luxurious feel to it (maybe the bathrobes that were furnished lent to that feeling). The bed was very comfortable, the TV of an exceptional size, and the window could be opened (a must for my wife who likes to feel air moving around her when she is sleeping). We ate lunch at the Hotel's restaurant and found the food to be very good (the service could have been a tad faster) Going online saved us an appreciable amount of money but to do so one must accept that the reservation cannot be canceled.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gihan Y
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with professional and pleasant staff who are doing their best to make your stay as comfortable as you can. Amazing location in the fancy and elegant Yorkville made it an amazing visit all together.I recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to have a wonderful time in Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but outdated and not up to par of other Park Hyatt properties”
Reviews.Author: Dennis8888
Reviews.Content: Brought my family and stayed @ this property from 12/1-12/5...you can definitely see the wear/tear on the rooms and public areas. The last time I stayed here was in September 2002, and at that time, the property was in much better condition. The furniture, fixtures, and carpeting in my room, Luxury Suite #928-929 with a connecting room to 927, were all pretty worn. You can tell that everything was a bit dated and about 10-15 years old. They did "upgrade" to flat screen TV's and better toiletries since my last visit back in 2002. Also, one of the double beds in #927 was concaved in, due to too much wear. However, the service was excellent, and the food in the hotel restaurant (Annona) was pretty good. I also heard the hotel spa is one of the best in Toronto, but I didn't get a chance to try it. The hotel definitely should be updated to compete with the newer Park Hyatts around the world....I stayed @ the Park Hyatt in Seoul back in April and that was the epitome of style and modern luxury. If that property was a 9, this Toronto Park Hyatt would be a 4-5, tops. This property more resembles a regular Hyatt, and a dated one at that. The location was excellent, though, in prime Yorkville area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. So-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: iscreenwriter
Reviews.Content: First time in Toronto. Great city. Booked this hotel for the location and the brand. Price was high but thought it would be worth it. Comfortable room but a bit small and not worth the dime. Very busy hotel but just a bit too expensive for it to be worth it. Location is prime though!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service”
Reviews.Author: jennylaika
Reviews.Content: I had a one night stay at the Park Hyatt for business. Every staff member was friendly and went over and above to provide excellent customer service. At breakfast, in the restaurant, the staff were cheerful and friendly (without it being annoying) and the food was excellent (expensive but pretty much the standard pricing for downtown Toronto hotels). I only had a block to walk but the desk clerk offered me and umbrella and luggage storage for the very rainy day. Once my meeting was complete, the concierge and doorman ensured I got a taxi quickly and I was on my way to the airport in no time.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jfed
Reviews.Content: This hotel is first class all the way. The staff is extremely competent and professional, and friendly in a businesslike manner. The housekeeping department does an excellent job - everything was immaculate in our room, the lobby, the elevator, etc. The room had a small living-room area with a sofa and chair, the bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was large and clean. The hotel is located right in the heart of the upscale Yorkville section of Toronto, across the street from the Royal Ontario Museum (ROM), and an easy walk to Queens Park. There are numerous restaurants and cafes within a few minutes walk as well. Finally, the rooftop lounge provides a cozy atmosphere in the evening, with a great view of the Toronto skyline. The cocktails, though expensive, are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: alan r
Reviews.Content: Check in easy, service great , the bar on the 8th was wonderful. Service was consistantly wonderful, but not in your way.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: killerbusiness
Reviews.Content: This trip was the best mix of being catered on, but still left alone. Everyone was very friendly, great location, quite night sleep -- Although the room was slightly more then we typically pay, it was still a great value! (Considering we paid only about $35 more then Holiday Inn rate)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but I'm sure it's worth the premium”
Reviews.Author: choptliva
Reviews.Content: I had some rather high expectations going in, considering the price premium it commands over the King Eddy and the Royal York, etc. Also, the Park Hyatt brand is supposedly very nice, so I was hoping to be wowed. The entrance circle and the lobby area certainly impressed, and service at the front desk was professional and knowledgeable. Doorman was courteous and helpful. So far so good. The room we had was away from the elevators, so that was good. But it was smallish for this level of hotel. Not small, no, but it's no more spacious than an average hotel room. No matter. Furnishing was fine, bathroom was clean and roomy. Everything worked. Ah, no coffeemaker, but it seems many hotels are doing away with them. What a shame. I don't really want to get all dressed in the morning and be presentable before my cup(s) of coffee. The hallway on my floor was narrow and somewhat dingy. The grey walls didn't help, I think. The bed was comfy, but not as nice as Fairmont beds, in my opinion. But there was really nothing major to complain about the room. Had dinner at the restaurant (and breakfast the next morning). Now that was a major disappointment. The dinner was really sophomoric. I can get this level of food anywhere for half the price. Service was diner-resque. Not impressed at all. Certainly it's nothing like the Epic or Toca. And breakfast? Well, I wanted a cup of coffee real quick and something to fill the stomach before going back on the road. Parking was valet for $40. I know that's par for the course in Toronto. But really, for $40 I had expected the car to have been parked indoors. When they brought the car out the next day, it was obvious it was parked outside. Water spots everywhere. Oh well, at least it wasn't snowing yet. But, having said that, they were efficient. All in all, not a bad hotel stay. Not a very excellent one either. And for the price, I think I'll look first at other places like the King Eddy. Perhaps my expectations were just too unrealistic going in.

Reviews.Title: “Very luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: FunkyMan3333
Reviews.Content: What can I say? I only stayed one night, but it's a very luxurious hotel. The bathroom could have used a little upgrading, but otherwise all was well! I enjoyed room service - the flat crust pizza was outstanding! I also particularly enjoyed a meeting in a conference room overlooking Avenue Road staring straight down University Ave. - very picturesque. It's a beautiful hotel, but also very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Toronto!!”
Reviews.Author: kcott
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for the weekend and we really enjoyed our stay! Kids were sent up cookies and milk the night we arrived...The location was perfect for visiting the ROM and window shopping in Yorkville! Great restaurants close by as well. We will stay again....

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JECW_57
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights during half term. Have stayed at Park Hyatts before but was very disappointed this time. It wasn't up to the standard we have come to expect. The first room we were allocated was overlooking the huge airconditioning unit and was noisy (even though we specifically requested a quiet room). The second room was quiet and comfortable, but suffered the distinct lack of a window!! It was like the black hole! Staff were ok but not especially attentive, with the exception of the concierge who was the single switched on and truly helpful member of staff we encountered. The breakfasts were way too fancy - even by Hyatt standards. I don't need asparagus with my scrambled egg! Everything had to be ordered, and although the waiting staff were attentive, it is so much easier and pleasanter to help yourself to fruit, cereal etc. My hungry 15 year old was barely satisfied with his 'Full English' and the next day I had to make a special request for him to have a sausage AND bacon please! Outrageous demands! The bar on the 18th floor had a spectacular view but was way too small for a hotel of this size. They also made a bit of a fuss about our son coming into the bar with us - we have never encountered this before in a hotel. There was nowhere else in the hotel where we could have had an evening drink together. Wouldn't return to this Toronto hotel - feel sure there are better places.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great luxury”
Reviews.Author: britt77
Reviews.Content: I was impressed! Location is fantastic, food was superb, staff are very attentive. Pricey, but worth it. My only observations ('complaint' is too strong a word): there was no tea/coffee maker in the room; and (not being a TV-person) the radio wasn't free.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room for a luncheon event”
Reviews.Author: cfilmcat
Reviews.Content: If you like mirrors, nice colours and chandeliers while you listen to speakers. This is the place. Not a boring old convention room. A treat.

Reviews.Title: “Back again after a 2 year Hiatus- Only Place to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: MTCB
Reviews.Content: Last time I was at the Park Hyatt (over 2 years ago) I was not that impressed BUT, this time around I felt like I was back to the Park Hyatt i know and love. Location is great, staff is exceptional and rooms and very cozy and comfortable- Really the only pleace for me to stay when in Toronto. Highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and roof-top bar is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: citygal07
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Toronto for 2 nights for a convention. This hotel is in a great location (if I had more time to explore the city!)- next to shopping and museums. It was very convenient to get to the metro (station is just 1 block away) and then minutes to get downtown to the convention center. The hotel rooms were very nice, clean, comfortable beds, etc. But the best thing about this hotel was the amazing bar on the roof. They have a terrace with absolutely gorgeous views! We sat outside and even though it was a bit chilly, the overhead heaters and blankets on each chair, provided all the warmth needed. We stayed even after closing and the staff was very accomodating- in no hurry to get us out of there. I'll definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel - Park Hyatt Toronto”
Reviews.Author: LondonBlonde
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend with a friend in Toronto at the Park Hyatt, and thought it was great. The area is good, and it is an easy walk to shops, restaurants and bars in what feels like a smart and safe part of town. We got upgraded to a lovely 2 bed large room, very spacious with a nice seating area. The rooms are neutrally decorated and the beds are super comfortable. Great bathroom, big counter for standing all your stuff on - and lovely large and fluffy towels, bathrobes etc. If I have any criticism, it would be that the whole place is very "neutral" - and maybe a bit lacking in character - inside the hotel, you could really be anywhere in the world. There was a bit of noise in the hallways at night - but that was a wedding party, which I guess probably happens most places. We didn't use most of the facilities but did visit the rooftop bar on two occasions... Amazing view of the city, great cocktails and nice food. Not cheap, but friendly service (on our last night we ordered a pizza and a salad to share, and they split our salad into two nice portions in separate bowls without being asked) and nice surroundings made it worthwhile. My top tip would be to take your coat with you and sit outside (they will bring you a blanket if you're too cold) for the amazing view. Would definitely recommend staying here on business or pleasure. We got a great corporate rate - $175CDN - but I'd have been satisfied at $250 given the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Really Liked it”
Reviews.Author: curlsgirl
Reviews.Content: The service is good, and the location perfect. Walking distance from all of Torontos attractions. Breakfast was very good. Our room was wonderful and quiet, and the beds were verey comfy. A great place to stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Old standby still great”
Reviews.Author: reevesNearOttawa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over 50 years ago and still return. It has been kept up to date; rooms are great and the staff are exceptional. Their location is second to none in Toronto. My only criticism is that they closed their great dining-room the Prince Arthur Room and now have a Morton's Steakhouse. It just does not cut it with the rest of the hotel. The Roof Top lounge is still the greatest "watering-hole" in TO. I look forward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people and amenities”
Reviews.Author: world_traveler2155
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business, and it was quite expensive (rate, room service, etc is on par with other 4 star hotels) but I was very happy with my stay. Love that they have FREE wi-fi, good coffee / cappacinos in the lobby in the morning, and FREE access to the steam rooms, spa lounge, and fitness center. Most places will charge for the spa, so I was so happy that I could make use of the lovely, serene spa space during my stay. Plus room service came within 20 min each time I ordered, everyone I met was very friendly and helpful, and they even opened the steam room half hour early for me one morning so I could get in and out before I had to leave for my meeting. The upstairs rooftop lounge reminds me of my nyc rooftop lounges - swanky for Toronto (and prices to match!). Oveall, great experience, and love that they don't nickel and dime you for every single amenity!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Toronto for its value!!!!”
Reviews.Author: osito181825
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel after looking at many reviews on tripadvisor. Its the best hotel in Toronto! I went with my wife and five year old daughter. They love it! What make its so good? Its location is 10 to 15 minutes away from any tourist attraction ( by car ). It is also near many of the best restaurants in the city. The hotel itself its elegant with professional and courteous service. Room service was quick and the food delightful. Its lounge its on the top of the building and has a beautiful open view of the city. Its close to all the fun venues but quiet if you want to sleep. Hey I even spotted two A-list actors in this hotel! I saw three star hotels charging more for the stay at their hotel. If I go to Toronto again I know where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect classy bed and breakfast hotel in a perfect location, don't expect more.”
Reviews.Author: Melfiroozi
Reviews.Content: Clean, classy hotel with the perfect location. It's in a heart of high class boutiques area. And you can also have fun with the yorkville and also tons of nice classy restaurants and cafes in that area. It's not a perfect match for a couple who want to enjoy a relax weekend cause there is no entertainment facility in the hotel for a couple. There is no pool but you can enjoy the complimentry spa that is a part of the hotel but there is nothing to share with you wife. Sauna, whirlpool and are all available but seperately. You cannit spend time with your wife there. Also, the most important messed up, is the valet parking. It's better to go get a parking spot infront of the hotel for overnight parking, it' cheaper and ofcourse you don't wait for an hour to get the car back for if they don't forget about it. When you book the hotel they tell you that there is a buffet breakfast on weekend but it's not. So don't plan for one if you don't want to get disappointment. But overally there are alot of fun around that area which you can be busy with. So finally, it is the best bed and breakfast you can find nothing much.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: bftravel
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Park Hyatt, but not for my mother or grandmother. We came to Toronto for two days to enjoy some shopping. Guest service at the Park Hyatt was wonderful as soon as we got out of our taxi, we were happy to hear we were upgraded to a nicer room at check-in! This hotel has a very friendly atmosphere, while enjoying como's at the roof top bar they offered to make dinner reservations for us to wherever we would like to go! They really do go out of their way to insure you have the best stay there. I will absolutely return in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: SarahElspeth
Reviews.Content: As soon as I arrived at the Park Hyatt I felt welcome by the wonderful staff. Every person I encountered during my stay at the Hyatt was curtains and helpful. The room was large, with a luxurious bed and big desk. The hotel had a very dark and cozy rooftop bar with amazing views of the Toronto skyline. The hotel is close to the upscale Bloor shopping district and many nice restaurants are with an easy stroll. The gorgeous University of Toronto campus is also very close. My only complaint is that the spa prices are obscenely high.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay as always”
Reviews.Author: river41
Reviews.Content: When we want a special weekend in the city, we choose to stay at the Park Hyatt. We love the location and the service and amenities are excellent. We especially enjoy the restaurant Annone. The rooftop bar is very nice (we chose to stay inside as the outdoor patio is very cramped and unappealing) The room itself was lovely but be sure to ask for a room away from the elevators. I'm a light sleeper and could hear them throughout the night. I have also used the spa in a past visit - pricey but a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “No Coffee or Tea facilities in Room”
Reviews.Author: SDW11
Reviews.Content: The real annoyance with this hotel was that there was no coffee or tea facilities in the room. Given it's star rating, I am absolutely astonished. This is the first hotel I have ever stayed in without that basic facility. Even the UK cheap and cheerful Travel Lodges have that. You get an ice bucket - but not coffee/tea. If you want to get showered, dressed and go downstairs, they have a take away coffee machine (but my colleagues said it did not work when they tried to use it). Want a coffee before you dress - forget it. I am not sure what all of the rooms looked like, but mine looked "worn" and dated. The carpet could do with a good clean by the door. The bedding had a tear in it. The shower splattered everywhere. The sink surround was marked. The decor has seen better days. The hair dryer was rubbish. The bed side lights too bright (enormous over the top bed side lights) - then you have a small double light on the desk which was totally inadequate. No reading lights anywhere. Only overhead lights are right by the entrance and in the bathroom. Bathroom magnification mirror is too far back and does not extend forward far enough, so you get back ache trying to see in it. On the plus side, a big bath (which was nice), big TV, nice smelling shower gel etc, decent storage facilities and internet provided. The location is much nicer than other areas of Toronto I have been to. Overall, I would look to stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: Fsanches
Reviews.Content: For a Park Hyatt is note as good as it should be. Everything was good, but not surprising or above other 4 stars hotels.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional hotel with great service - only wish it had a pool”
Reviews.Author: mflan46
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews on this site, I was a little hesitant to book a room at the Park Hyatt, but after speaking to staff, and some locals that I know, I was assured that this was an exceptional hotel. I was not disappointed, from check in to room cleanliness to the restaurant. Traveling with a 2 year old takes a lot of accommodation, which the Park Hyatt staff were readily willing to provide. All the staff were quite helpful. When we checked in, we were upgraded to a room in the new tower of the hotel. The room was very large, and luxurious. I inspected the room with a lot of detail as my son was going to be running around the room, touching everything. Of course we gave most areas an additional sanitation, but I will say that the room was very clean. The bed was extremely comfortable, and updated. We made reservations at the spa to celebrate my wive's birthday, and the spa was definitely a nice experience. The only complaint I have is that there was no co-ed hot tub to sit and relax in, and the tea room where you go before and after your massage was quite crowded and not really relaxing. After my massage, I enjoyed a workout in the fitness room. It was a little small, but had fantastic LifeFitness cardio equipment with integrated TV's. Everything was clean and in perfect operating condition. The addition of a functional trainer would make the room perfect! As far as the hotel goes, there was always enough staff around to help you with ANY need that you may have. All the staff were very friendly and treated our son with the respect of any other guest in the hotel. I only wish this hotel had a swimming pool to enjoy the fantastic weather we had in, but everything else it does have provided us with an incredible getaway to enjoy Yorkville from.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Umfalotta
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a number of times over the past several years. The hotel is in a very good location. The Yorkville neighborhood has nice shopping, lots of restaurant choices, and is also a very convenient walk to the subway station, which gets you to other sites in the city very easily. The hotel also has a rooftop bar, a cafe, ATM, good restaurant, etc., so it is easy to make yourself comfortable right within the confines of the Hyatt itself. The place is clean and well maintained, the rooms are large and comfortable, and I've always found the service to be gracious. In fact, when we've had small issues or problems over the years, the staff has always been anxious to fix the situation and make sure we are satisfied. The front desk staff, restaurant and bar waitstaff on my most recent visits were especially nice and helpful. I would give the hotel a five rather than a four if not for the fact that we've occasionally noticed our rooms showing minor wear and tear (a safe that doesn't work, a toilet that runs, furniture that looks worn) -- but those things have been few and far between so the Park Hyatt is still my hotel of choice in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: chippaul
Reviews.Content: The rooms are really nice and spacious and the bathrooms are nice! I stayed in the North wing of the hotel. The hotel is next to the ROM and museum subway lines and walking distance to nice shops and a whole foods grocery store so there are lots of amenities around.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a wedding”
Reviews.Author: Rbattis
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in the posh Yorkville area. Great room and our view was of the CN Tower in the distance. Wedding on the top floor with balconies, wow. Parking was expensive. Their workout room was high end and is part of a beautiful Spa. Courteous, friendly staff. We would return in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “a very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Jill143
Reviews.Content: We have in the past stayed at the Four Seasons in Toronto, but this time the University had booked us in and chose the Park Hyatt. We were very pleasantly surprised by the comfort of the hotel. A huge (and clean!) bed, two armchairs for reading (though they could be comfier), and a well-equipped bathroom. We particularly appreciated the free computer room provided. The retaurant serves very good food, and it is a nice change not to have to trek back and forth to a breakfast buffet, but to sit on the comfortable banquettes while staff fetch your order. Hotel personnel were all helpful and friendly. The only downside is that the rooftop bar is really too small to accommodate the number of people wanting to use it, and the downstairs bar has been sacrificed to make room for a spa (which we have never seen the point of). There is also no public lounge or reading room. But the location is unbeatable. I think we will pick this in preference to the Four Seasons on our next visit--especially since the latter is now vacating its old building for a massive high-rise.

Reviews.Title: “Bedding is Filthy Go Across the Street to the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: kaay_see
Reviews.Content: My friend chose this hotel to celebrate her 40th Birthday. We checked in, had champagne in our suite and had reservations in Annona restaurant in the hotel. The dinner was amazing and well worth the money, staff had excellent recommendations for wine, dinner. After dinner, we walked around Yorkville, had coffee and dessert. We got ready for bed and went to sleep. My friend was wearing a nice new expensive white nightie (this detail you will see later). She turned the light on to find the bathroom in the middle of the night and on her way back to bed, she let out a scream. Her fitted sheets were filthy, stained, the sheets were never cleaned. There was fecal matter all over the bed (urine, semen etc.) it was absolutely disgusting. We called the front desk and the could not do anything about it until the morning when the housekeeping manager was inn. The odd thing was there was no top sheets on either bed so I cannot imagine they change the duvet comforter after each guest leaves. We ended up sleeping or trying to sleep fully clothed as her new white nightie was covered in matter from the previous guest. She had to take a hot shower for a while and throw out her nightie. The next morning what was supposed to be a nice day, we went down to get the hotel manager at 7am. He could not be bothered to come up to our suite but send the housekeeping manager who was appalled by what he saw, called another staff person to see it. He apologized and said he had new housekeeping staff and will assure they will change the sheets after each guest and he will be talking to the front desk about it and the hotel management. We go to check out, not an apology from management, we still had to pay for our very expensive room. They offered to comp our $20 parking and that was it. We were shocked by their lack of compassion for our ordeal. My friend who was in tears by the experience wrote a letter to the hotel and not a response. I have many friends in the film industry who come to Toronto each September, they all know of our experience and I tell them all to stay at the Four Seasons. We tell everyone of our story, for a hotel of this calibre your money is spend elsewhere. I will never stay here again, or recommend staying her. Go for the food, or drinks on the 18th floor but sleep in another hotel where the sheets are cleaned. I recommend the Four Seasons across the street.

Reviews.Title: “The only name you need to know in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: lonestar77
Reviews.Content: By far, my favorite hotel to visit on business. It is everything you could ask for when you are on the road. The park hyatt has some of the nicest, most comfortable rooms you could imagine. Tremendous stay all around. Could have slept in the room for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “You just can't beat Hyatt - Especially the Park Hyatt Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: Spa-Foodies
Reviews.Content: We've stay here many times, during he Film Festival and other times just for the heck of it, and each time the experience is as good if not better as the time before! A perfect location in Yorkville, walkable to dozens of god restaurants, great shops, and other must-see Toronto places, conveniently accessed by car or transit too. The service here is typical 'Hyatt' high class - very friendly, thorough and personal. The hotel is clean and stylish, the rooms are large & up-to-date, the room service is great, the restaurants are great for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. And oh yeah... the Stillwater Spa is one of the best anywhere! Truly exceptional. We truly can't wait to come back to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saphire81
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in June and loved this hotel. The rooms, lobby and common areas are beautiful and well kept. Our room was in what is considered the "old tower" but you would never know it as everything is well maintained. Some friends stayed in the "newer" part of the hotel and their room was gorgeous as well. One cool advantage to this hotel is it offers a free car service to guests. Just book at the concierge desk. We used it when we had dinner reservations at another hotel, saved us cab fair! I rated this hotel 4 stars instead of 5 due to the fact that it only has valet parking, which costs $40 a night. With a tip, parking cost us over $50 A NIGHT. Thats $200 just for parking alone for the 4 nights we stayed. Hands down the highest parking rates I have paid at ANY hotel. Oh, and no wi fi in the rooms, only available in the lobby. Would definitely splurge and stay here again for a special occasion though.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding for Father's Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: 52marv
Reviews.Content: My family (Mom, Dad, 14 and 11 year old) spent Father's Day Weekend at the Park Hyatt and had a wonderful time! First the location is amazing!! The Royal Ontario Museum is right around the corner, there are several subway stops a block away. For dad, the Casa Haban Cigar Shop was across the street and around trhe corner and he went every day. He was in Heaven! The Hotel is right in the middle of Yorkville and around the corner from the Mink Mile on West Bloor. We spent several wonderul hours walking around, people watching and enjoying Toronto. The hotel has lovely staff, they went out of their way to make our stay special, always with a smile. The room was large and comfortable, although the beds are doubles, not true queens. My husband and I had a wonderful time on the rooftop lounge with the most amazing view of Toronto and good drinks. Plus, you can buy good Cigars from the bar to smoke up there. There were only two small issues with the hotel. First, our door seemed to be broken; it was very hard to open and the key card was hard to use. Second, the concierge on our first night was not helpful at all. We asked for restaurant recomendations and she suggested delis and pubs. When we pushed for more creative ideas, she told us about a Chinese Restaurant, Zin. We walked there and it has been closed for some time. Luckily, the other concierges were really good and gave us great ideas and were very helpful. Otherwise, we LOVED the Park Hyatt! There were only two s

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt but not a Park Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Ptitlu
Reviews.Content: Average, not a Park Hyatt as in Europe or Asia. As very often in North America, F&B is overcharge, 40 CAN DOLLARS for a coffee and yogurt. Locaton is good for business and leisure

Reviews.Title: “Dated Luxury in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: russdorth
Reviews.Content: We had to Pick our daughter up from school(UOT)....we had no idea it was directly across the street. We loved the area for cafes, shopping and people watching.. Go for the deluxe size room, worth the extra $ for a much bigger room. The hotel itself had a luxury feel but felt like I was in the early nineties. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The valet parking was a mess...it took over 20 min to get our car....we thought they misplaced it. Once again the highlight was the location....would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spa!”
Reviews.Author: KittyTranSenko
Reviews.Content: We took our girlfriend there for her 40th birthday for a girls' getaway for the weekend. We had planned spa treatments for all of us at the Stillwater Spa within this hotel for Friday night. This Spa is the most professional and sophisticated spa in town and probably in Ontario. I believe it is the rated in the top 5 in Canada. I loved it so much, I took my husband there for our one year anniversary for a couples massage. The hotel itself was beautiful, the rooms are a bit dated but it is an old property. The service was wonderful, we ordered room service for our dinner and had lots of wine in our room, so we can chat and laugh without bothering other patrons. The only down side to this hotel is that parking is very costly even for their guests, it's $40 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Covenient for Shopping”
Reviews.Author: zahidi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. Huge room with huge fully equipped bathroom. Located very near Yorkville, the high end shopping district, just across the street. 2 underground train stations within 5 minute walk. Niagara Falls in about 40 minute drive away. Free internet with wi-fi. Business centre provide free printing self-service. The only slack is: there's no complimentary coffee/tea in the room. It's served by coffee machine at the lobby only during morning. Bottled water is provided with request.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business trip - expensive, but not on the small stuff”
Reviews.Author: mgiarc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights on business and was very impressed, especially because they avoid all the annoying habits of other 5* hotels I have stayed in. In-room internet connection - $30 per day? No - free. Posting a couple of letters back to the UK - no problem sir; we'll take care of those - no charge. Food and drinks in the bar (on the roof with great views) and breakfast ($24) are expensive, but not so eye-wateringly expensive that you feel aggrieved, even when it's not your own money. The food was also surprisingly wholesome for North America - breakfast with asparagus, not cheese! The room was very comfortable. In short, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great location”
Reviews.Author: LMB77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located in Yorkville, nice area of the city. The service is excellent, the staff members are pleasant and helpful. A variety of nice breakfasts are proposed at the restaurant. If you stay in this hotel it worth going to the bar on 18th floor to look at the city view, probably one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - I cannot fault this hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: TKay_11
Reviews.Content: We completely enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The service was impeccable, our room was exceptionally clean. The food was delicious, very satisfied with breakfast. The staff were always willing to go the extra mile. The location of the hotel was also very convenient. I really cannot find a fault with this hotel. It's highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “She Played While He Worked”
Reviews.Author: urbantourist
Reviews.Content: Accompanied my husband to a business conference in Toronto that took place at the Park Hyatt. We enjoyed this hotel much more than our previous stay at the Fairmont Royal York. We loved the Park Deluxe King suite that we stayed in! Both the living room and luxurious marble washroom were spacious and well appointed. Turndown service was a nice touch. Though we didnâ€™t pay the bill, I believe the corporate rate for this upper floor suite was a very reasonable $175/night. The location of this hotel is convenient for shopaholics as itâ€™s a stoneâ€™s throw away from boutique shopping in Yorkville and designer shopping on Bloor. However, itâ€™s worth noting that there is no airport shuttle available and the hotel is a $60 cab ride from Pearson. Having missed dinner due to my late flight, I asked the concierge for late-night food suggestions upon arrival. Though he initially thought most nearby restaurants would be closed (other than McDonalds, Tim Hortons, and Room Service), he did come up with a lifesaver â€“ Hemmingways Pub across the street. Afterwards, I enjoyed a drink and view of the city at the Roof Lounge on the 18th floor. Unfortunately, I didnâ€™t have time to enjoy the steam room, sauna, hot tub, or fitness centre at the Stillwater Spa (available to hotel guests at no cost); however, I did take a mini tour and the spa amenities seemed wonderful. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Park Hyatt. We highly recommend it for both business and leisure!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, personal service.”
Reviews.Author: FRTravelbug
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for one night with my mother. We arrived early and we able to check-in to our upgraded room right away. We were struck by the friendly staff from the moment we arrived and this carried on throughout our stay. The room was a generous size and we both had a good sleep. The bathroom was excellent and the extra amenities were nice. The concierge service was great. They recommended a restaurant in the evening and kept our bags the next day when we went shopping. Again everyone was so friendly. We went for breakfast at the hotel and while the prices were quite high we split their special and were satisfied. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely superb”
Reviews.Author: so3003
Reviews.Content: We had a superb week in Toronto living in a Park Suite at the Park Hyatt hotel, at the end of March. Everything about our experience in this hotel was just perfect. I'd arrived from a work trip to the US while my partner came directly from the UK, and a week here was just what we needed. Our airport taxi dropped us at the entrance, and the door staff had our bags on a trolley before we were out of the taxi. They looked at our luggage tags and greeted us by name. In the lobby my partner was shown to an armchair while I checked us in. The person who greeted me outside introduced me to the desk staff by name and ensured check-in was processed promptly. A concierge then showed us briefly where the spa, restaurant etc were and directed us to the lifts and our room. This was amazing service given that we haven't ever stayed at this hotel before and aren't members of their frequent guest programme. The room was really very impressive. It was a Park Suite, which consists of a living room and bedroom (see my photos). The living room has a minibar (which we didn't use), sofa, writing desk, coffee table and chair. There's a flatscreen TV too. The bedroom has a King bed (very comfortable), a further flatscreen tv, bedside tables etc. There is an ipod docking station in each room, and each room has a large cupboard with a motion-activated light. There is ample wardrobe and drawer space. The bathroom was very nice, with quality toiletries that were replenished as required. There was a nightly turndown service including two bottles of water, and the room was serviced at least twice daily (judging by how often things were tidied if we were back at the hotel during the day). There was free wifi throughout the hotel, which was easy to use. A newspaper was delivered to our room every morning in a branded Park Hyatt bag, which I thought was a nice touch (though I only read it once - I was on holiday!) We didn't have any spa treatments but as hotel guests we could use the facilities, including the relaxation area (with tea, snacks, magazines, fishtank etc), and male/female jacuzzi, sauna and steam rooms. All the staff we interacted with were helpful, friendly and courteous. Everyone from the chambermaids to the concierge, bellhop, spa staff and front-of-house team were great and really added to our stay. The concierge team were especially helpful, and coordinated the repair of some luggage which had been damaged by the airline in transit. The hotel is in the trendy Yorkville area of Toronto, and has a subway station ("museum" station) in the next block, just past the Royal Ontario Museum. You can get to the main financial area etc by subway within ten minutes. There are lots of very nice restaurants and high-end shops (Tiffany, Vera Wang etc) within walking distance. The hotel also has a towncar service in the mornings and evenings though we didn't use this. I've stayed in a lot of very nice hotels and this ranks among my best hotel experiences. I was very impressed by the Park Hyatt and I'd highly recommend them to anyone looking for a top quality hotel stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “4th time staying”
Reviews.Author: 1974sniper
Reviews.Content: I travel to toronto for business ever few months park hyatt is always a great stay friendly staff clean rooms great decor, fair priced for toronto. front desk is truly there to help. will be staying there in 3 weeks for my next business trip

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: green-machine-1969
Reviews.Content: First, I must say that I've never written a review before but after this experience, I felt the need to contribute to the all of the excellent reviews. I spent days and days reading reviews of similar hotels before I made the decision to stay here. Wow, did I make the right choice!! My wife and I were in need of some alone time away from our young boys. We new we wanted to stay in Yorkville and do some shopping, use the spa, enjoy a romantic dinner, relax, etc. I travel a lot on business and have stayed in many hotels. I can honestly say that the entire staff here are the best I've seen. Every staff member, be it, the valet, bell-hop, concierge, house-keeping, spa, restaurant, or front desk were absolutely fantastic. No attitude and very happy to assist with anything. Extremely polite, friendly, and courteous. We had breakfast at the Hotels' Annona Restaurant and it was simply fantastic. The 18th floor Lounge is incredible. We had light lunch and also enjoyed a few romantic late evening drinks. The food was terrific. The atmosphere is awesome. Stephanie, our server on both occasions is absolutely magnificent. She alone, made our enjoyable weekend even more enjoyable. We had dinner at Morton's Steakhouse located next door (not affiliated to the hotel). Awesome too! Stillwater Spa is superb. I enjoyed the Men's lounge equipped with Steam, Sauna, Hot tub, and private lounging areas equipped with tv's are the ultimate way to unwind. This hotel has now become our "go-to" hotel. We won't even bother looking elsewhere. The Park Hyatt has everything we needed and there's so many great things to see and do. Plus, the extent of fabulous nearby restaurants makes this our #1 choice when we want to come to the city. Thank You Park Hyatt Staff. Money well spent. We'll be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a top-notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: MSkinner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here March 4th 2011. Would definitely be one of the top hotels in Toronto. Rooms were a good size & very old-style elegant yet modern (recently redone, maybe?). We were in the North Tower, which apparently has slightly bigger rooms. Bed was fantastic - a great sleep. Staff were exceptional. A medium-sized workout room with everything you'd need. It's attached to the spa, which looks to be just amazing. Location was great. Close to the Museum, high-end shopping (if that's what you want - we didn't shop, though), and a whole lot of little 'bistro' type restaurants that were really good (had a great lunch at Joe Badali's). Hotel had a very nice up-scale bar on the 18th floor. Small & elegant. If you're looking for a romantic weekend getaway, or just a 5 star hotel, this is your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and service”
Reviews.Author: coloradocynthia
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room...I was upgraded to a King Deluxe. Service was friendly with the exception of one concierge who was not very interested in giving us restaurant suggestions when we did not want her original choice of Japanese food. The front desk staff was great, as was everyone else I encountered.

Reviews.Title: “service oriented staff. great spa. nice rooftop lounge”
Reviews.Author: bedatrando
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for long weekend because of an engagement party that was in the hotels rooftop lounge and i must say the weekend was wonderful at this hotel. first off from the check in clerk to the maids , everyone was very nice and always looking to help. the room was very spacious and clean. it had a nice elegant decor yet still incorporated current technology with a 42" plasma and ihome ipod player. we spent a day at the spa and the massages we had were great. although there is no pool area the spa allows you to use the steam room / Jacuzzi/ sauna ect at no cost even if you do not have and paid service done there. location is good next to all the high end shops on bloor st. and the lastly the party at the rooftop lounge was beautifully done. food and service were great, and the ambiance was top notch with a wonderful view of the city and an outdoor balcony to escape from the music to enjoy a quiet cigarette with our drinks. all in all the hotel was super and probably the best value for a higher end hotel in the bloor street area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & bed!”
Reviews.Author: Spencertraveller
Reviews.Content: Slept like a baby, did not want to wake up in that lovely bed, almost as great as the Heavenly bed. Service is superb and lots of staff to check in & out. Unlike some hotels where I never understand @ midday, only have 2 people on when they know lots of people check out, I had 3 people calling me, can I help you here, great! Location is superb indeed. Now: Check in entrance is bizare but thanks to the doorman who tells you to enter here! Curtain in the room was so dirty you can see the dirt on it. But it appears it comes from the very noisy heating unit that makes way too much noice even when you dont have the fan on! If you are staying in the nborth tower - madness of an elevator!!! 3 elevators and the room service and cleaning people use one too. It takes forever to arrive - awful! If you ar ein the SOUTH tower, 2 elevators, nightmare!!! Nice big TV but quality of picture is awful- get HD. And the converters look so dirty I washed my hands after touching them always. Too many numbers missing too! One thing though...should you have any issues, they will certainly fix in a very good time!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel for the business traveller, great service”
Reviews.Author: mjaeger
Reviews.Content: I am generally not one to stay at the Hyatt chain of hotels, simply because it is too much money to spend for one night's accomodations, however, my clients treated me (royally) to this hotel the night before an important meeting in downtown Toronto. I expected the hotel to be top notch, like the Sofitel chain, or better, and I was not to be disappointed. This is the hotel where undoubtedly many of the rich, famous & powerful have stayed, whether it is for business reasons, or the Toronto Film Festival. Is the hotel pretentious and expensive? Well of course it is! But for the well-heeled (as opposed to the budget concious traveller like most average people) this hotel is probably "run of the mill". By saying that I am not knocking the hotel one bit. The north tower is particularly well-adorned with wood, marble and the like, not to mention chandliers and superior art work likely worth more than my car! The hotel lacks a pool but apparently has a world class spa, Stillwater, which unfortunately I had no time or an extra $300 to indulge in. (Check it out on the web, the spa looks amazing...) My room was a one bedroom suite with a separate dining room/living area in an adjacent room. I don't exactly know the price, but I suspect it was in the $400 plus range. Each "room" had a full bath, a sitting area and large screen LG LCD TV of approximately 42 inches in diameter (My guess). Yes, did I mention I had TWO large screen TV's! The room was suitably appointed, and the massive King Size bed was probably the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in, perhaps with the exception of my own. In other words, no complaints or concerns about the "ginormous" gorgeously appointed room, and especially about the service - from the concierge to the bell hops. My clients and I had dinner at the Annona restaurant situate inside the hotel - both on the night of our arrival and indeed, on the following night. On both nights I had Scallop based dishes, the first of which was salad based, and both of which were very tasty indeed. In fact, the scallops had to be the LARGEST scallops I had ever seen or been served in any restaurant ever. They were cooked to near perfection, and could be cut like "butter" with no dryness or sense or being overcooked. My company and I drank white wine (Penfold's Chardonnay) and local beer with our meals, all of which suited our dinners to a tee. The only disappointment with the meals was the "chip like" bread served with the meals, and also the regular bread and "dips". I can't even really describe it, but I have had better tasting and softer bread, AND fresh baked at far lesser restaurants - even East Side Marios! However, all other aspects of the meal were superb, so don't get me wrong. Annona is a very nice restaurant, including the decore and the service was very very good. At the conclusion of the meals (and my stay) I didn't get a chance to see the bills, but I was very grateful to my hosts for the opportunity to stay at this lovely hotel in a swanky part of Toronto I don't normally partake in. I have stayed at the Westin, the Royal York, the Sheraton, the Best Western, and Sutton Place in Toronto, but this property easily tops the list! I doubt I will ever return to this hotel (unless I win the lottery) but if you are looking for a high quality meal/dinner, and superior overnight accomodations you won't be disappointed in the Park Hyatt. Impeccable indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: peacepax
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our overnight stay at this elegant hotel. Service was very good and check in was efficient. Also loved the spa, very relaxing. We got a great view of the CN tower from our room. Hotel is in Yorkville area, checked out nearby restaurants and museum across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, great location”
Reviews.Author: retropj
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in December to do some shopping and to see a Leafs game. When booking we reserved a Park Deluxe King room, it was about $40 extra per night, as it was described as a larger room. When we checked in they gave us a room that I would describe as a one bedroom suite. It had a separate living room, and bedroom. Two large flat screen TVâ€™s and most importantly, two full bathrooms, which we found quite convenient. The first room we checked into had an odor of cigarette smoke. They did confirm at check in that we would be in a non-smoking room. When we called down to the front desk they were quick to respond and moved us to another room. The hotel also offers a car service for no additional charge. This was a nice surprise for us. Iâ€™m not sure what their radius is, but we took advantage the car a couple times. The location is great for shopping. Many stores are within walking distance. For those that are not, the Museum subway stop is only about Â½ a block away. We twice ate at their restaurant on the main floor, Annona, once for breakfast and once for lunch. The food and service was good. In the past we have stayed at the Four Seasonâ€™s, which is just across the street. Service at the Park Hyatt was just as good for almost Â½ the price.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: InLoveWithTravel21
Reviews.Content: What I value most in a hotel is cleanliness and quiet and the Hyatt definitely has those features. The room was clean and the stay was uneventful. The location is great next to shopping, the ROM and close to the subway. The only downside is that the food is overpriced and not that great, but we only had one meal there so maybe it was our food choices. I would definitely not order room service, but other than that, everything was just fine. Also, I wish the rooms with two beds had queen rather than double beds.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable upscale hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYLOgmJET
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a large group to attend the MLS championship game at BMO field. The check-in process was very efficient. I was originally place in a guestroom adjacent to the elevator shaft and they quickly moved me upon request as the hum of the elevators is not soothing to me. The rooms are very large, comfortable beds and free wifi. The hotel is in a great location, convenient to shopping, restaurants, etc. The highlight of the hotel is the lounge on the 18th floor. We had a terrific view of the holiday parade below as well as the Toronto skyline. Zap (as I believe he is called) the young bartender from Bosnia was excellent in crafting cocktails and talking to us about local attractions. I look forward to returning to Toronto and would certainly consider staying again at the Park Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iggyhawk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Hyatt recently for some business meetings. The service provided by the staff was truly excellent. Both the hotel rooms and meeting rooms were topnotch as well. The Yorkville location generally worked for our purposes, but was a bit inconvenient for some coming from the downtown core. Nice hotel and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Plasmatico
Reviews.Content: Park Hyatt Toronto is in a great location, very sleek and clean. We loved everything about this property (though be aware this seems to be an older property than PH Chicago or PH Buenos AIres) - our only caveat was the concierge were kind of clueless, very unlike Park Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Lovely Staff 5 *****”
Reviews.Author: foodie305
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Park Hyatt in Toronto"s Yorkville area. I had previously stayed at the Four Seasons Hotel across the street. The price at the Park Hyatt was much less and the hotel was equal in amenities and rooms. The Park Hyatt hotel was updated and the rooms were nice. Outside the door we could walk to the Royal Ontario Museum or stroll on Bloor street, a sophisticated shopping area with high end retailers like Chanel Guccci Cartier etc...The restaurant in the hotel served a nice breakfast though pricey. There are other places to go nearby by that are more reasonable. You can walk to the best restaurants. There is an movie theater nearby that has wonderful foreign films. I would return to the Park Hyatt again. Good value, good location, pleasant ammenties.....

Reviews.Title: “Style & Class In the heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: johnwhitemaui
Reviews.Content: Aloha, I must say that being in the hotel business, I have the opportunity to stay in many wonderful locations. The Park Hyatt was a step above. The service was wonderful at all times (valet, bell, concierge, front desk, F&B staff, housekeeping, etc.). Even though the hotel was a full occupancy the entire staff had a helpful smile and genuine interest in me as a guest. The rooms were wonderful, comfortable, relaxing and yet able to get work done. The showers were great for a bigger/taller persson such as myself. The shoeshine is a very nice touch and needed while on the road. Mahalo to all the wonderful staff at the Park Hyatt!! John

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a nice part of the city.”
Reviews.Author: Cartman1968
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near a subway stop and what I am told is the nicest part of the city. I have been here for a couple of days now and one big plus is that the Royal Ontario Museum is right next door as is a great musical instrument store and a lot of nice restaurants. They have a bar at the top of the south tower that has a great view of the city. They have a free car service but I think it's only available in the evenings. There is a spa but no pool. The rooms are big...decent but not immaculate. My room hada a hold in the wall- it is between the size of a nickel and a quarter- not all the way through but I point it out in that the place could maybe use some touch ups. The food was really good for breakfast room service. Their orange juice is excellent- hand squeezed. Wireless high speed internet is free here which is nice. Small gift shop. Good concierge service but they were overworked. The beds were ok but the mattresses a little firm for my liking- not quite as bad as Hilton though. Not sure what is up with hotels taking your sheets away. Except for the first night I have only had a comforter. Hilton seems to do this in Europe too and I am not sure why. Also they only left a breakfast room service door knob menu on the first night which is common at hotels it seems like. Overall decent. Try to get a good deal... not the St. Regis but not bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Sanine
Reviews.Content: My travel companion and I arrived late at night, hoping to make the best out of an involuntary overnight stay in Toronto following a delayed transatlantic flight with missed connections and several rebookings on a complex itinerary. Looking forward to immersing ourselves in a pleasurable Park Hyatt experience, we were greeted rather brusquely at check-in. When presenting my GP Platinum card, the check-in clerk curtly lectured me that my details were already in their system and demanded to be handed my credit card instead (rather than politely asking for it) - not quite the expected status recognition! Room was similarly sub-par. No evidence of Hyatt's "best available room within category booked"-policy for Platinum members: We were assigned a 2nd floor room with awful "views" (and sounds) of the adjacent ventilation shafts, despite my preference for high floors (which was also in their system). This is a large property and it was certainly not busy at the time of our stay; nor were we booked on some heavily discounted rate or indeed the lowest room category. Our room was spotless and fairly large, which was a plus. Decor felt more nineties than timeless. Wall sockets were inconveniently located for laptop use. Closet door was broken, bathroom door did not lock. Water pressure was insufficient. I did enjoy the (non-complimentary) jar of chocolate-coated almonds. We could (and should) have asked to be moved, but arriving tired late at night we did not bother; and in any case ought not to have been put in such a position in the first place. Only by chance did we learn of the complimentary shuttle service, shortly before departure. When we tried to use it after check-out, we were told that it was not available at that time of day. Had we been informed about this at check-in, we might have been able to time our check-out differently, or otherwise make use of the shuttle during our stay. It did feel like a potentially excellent hotel. Had we encountered a friendlier welcome and a different room, we would certainly have enjoyed our stay. Being treated as we were, we did not.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpainMT
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at a good position beside the Bloor road restaurants. the rooms are small but adequate. The top covering peak bar that is highly suggested by other ones verified a bit frustrating, the outlook is not that large, furthermore stay inside as it can get breezy outside. I registered thru Expedia as a pre-paid exceptional, and I was not adept to get a acknowledgment from the Hotel to assertion VAT refund, that is not the hotel's obvious error but just hold that in mind.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: CavKA
Reviews.Content: this is a fab hotel. a few things. it is quite central. despite it's location in central Toronto, it is quiet. the hotel staff are lovely and if the weather is hospitable, the rooftop bar is lovely. There is also a lovely spa. The room is comfortable. Nothing amazing but really a good solid hotel. The other really lovely added touch is there is a hotel car that will take you within 5 kilometers of the hotel for free. It's underused, but a lovely touch. A definite pick if you are in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & clean but won't stay again - no coffee or ice machines”
Reviews.Author: TravellinMofo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights at this hotel. Lobby is stuffy and uninviting. Front desk staff and all employees I encountered were very friendly. Had a room on the 12th floor in the north tower with 2 queen beds. Room was VERY clean and nice. Large size room with flat screen TV. View of Avenue Rd. and Bloor from window. Likes: Dave Graves toiletries, large soaker tub and large bathroom, free wi-fi with strong connection, comfy enough bed, a few blocks from a Whole Foods Market Dislikes: no coffee maker, ice bucket in room but no ice machines in hotel - must call room service & who wants to tip for ice?!?, can hear lots of street noise, hotel restaurant too expensive with limited menu, most of the surrounding area was high-end retail and I just wanted a place to get a bottle of water!, parking situation Hotel site claims self-parking is $38 CAN. You have to park across the way on Cumberland St. at the Four Seasons - where the sign claims that the $38 fee is for overnight parking and that there is an additional daily max - which means it costs more than $38 to park there! Fortunately, there are 2 other garages on Cumberland. The 2nd one is cheaper - I parked there for a grand total of $63 CAN for a two night stay. For cheap coffee, there is a Tim Horton's nearby on Bloor just a few blocks to the west. And the coffee at the Whole Foods Market isn't bad either. Next time, I think I'll stay at the Yorkville Marriott on Bloor near Yonge St, because there were a lot of nice priced restaurants and some markets on Yonge. Plus a subway stop is right under that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Roberto48
Reviews.Content: Thought I was buying a share in the parking structure - C$ 43.70 including HST per day. Rooms in north tower comfortable and whole facility very clean. Staff were very courteous and seemed genuinely interested in making ones stay pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, upscale - where's the coffee?”
Reviews.Author: AlmaFudd
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times for business, although I ended up liking the Quality Inn nearby simply for the in-room coffee. The Park Hyatt did not have it! You had to order (very expensive) room service. However, it is great for the upscale rooms and restaurant. The rooms are mid-sized with luxurious bedding and quality furniture and fixtures. The restaurant is good, not memorable. The staff are especially friendly and seem genuinely cheerful. The shopping nearby is fabulous - when I brought my daughter here for a birthday trip, we wore ourselves out shopping. Tip: if you find the hotel too pricey for breakfast, the Cora's nearby on Bloor has an extensive breakfast menu.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: restleswanderer
Reviews.Content: great hotel which provides outstanding service. Located near Yorkville, great shopping and resteraunts. Roof top bar has excellent food and drinks. We sat out side and felt a bit cool so staff got my wife a throw to keep her warm. Great place to talk with friends with no loud music and a fantastic view of downtown toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: accucut
Reviews.Content: 1st morning ordered Pancakes (in room dinning) The were dry and tasted like cornbread. These were not whole grain just regular. Paid about $30 for 3 small pancakes with bacon. Was placed in small suite rm 1512 next to service elevator which turned out to be very noisy all night long. We requested to be moved and staff was quick to help us move to another room all be it much smaller but a better view. Asked for change for $20 US to CA from front desk and was told that I would get $19 CA for 20 US. Even though the exchange rate was $1.08 US to $1 Cn. All other venues gave us 1 to 1 exchange. Beds are not as comfortable as the 4 seasons which we stayed in the 1st of the week in Vancouver. Ask concierge for directions to near by sushi restaurants and was given vague directions on a local map with no names written next to each circled area which I found unusual. I am still here and leaving in the morning. We will see how tonight goes. This will be the last of 4 nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “Turn-Down The Only Downside”
Reviews.Author: SCB_JR
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location! We did arrive late but our room was warm and a welcome place to spend the following 3 days. Check-in was easy and pleasant with excellentl assistance regarding our restaurant reservation which was 15 minutes away. Room, bed and pillows, bathroom impeccably clean and well maintained. Service and staff, including valets, were excellent. Breakfast (3 days) was perfect and attentively served. The concierge team was ridiculously helpful providing intel as to many of the great places â€¦ and transportation â€¦ available. The Yorkville area (across the street) is great for general shopping, eating, and people watching. Getting around, in and out of the hotel was easy and quick (a pleasant surprise). The only downside was the turn-down. They showed up at 6 pm while we were preparing to go out and did leave a room service plate outside of our door until we spoke to the front desk next morning â€¦ but if thatâ€™s the worst, then so be it. They did take care of it. Great Time! and would return!!

Reviews.Title: “A Few FYI's on the Park Hyatt...Very Good But Short of Amazing”
Reviews.Author: TurtleCreekTraveller
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of Park Hyatts and while the Toronto facility is really good, it is a little short of their most memorable properties. First for the FYI's: 1. Some rooms have benefitted have a recent recarpet and some have not, so I'd request a fresher room. My first room had not been recarpeted and while the room was acceptable, it felt tired. The recarpeted rooms are much more pleasant. 2. If you are a light sleeper, exterior noise can be an issue, especially on weekends if you are on a lower floor and facing Avenue Road. Yorkville obviously draws young ultra-affluents and they enjoy playing with their Ferraris and Cayenne Turbos when they leave the clubs, resulting in loud and throaty exhaust notes penetrating some rooms. Highest floors furthest away from Bloor Street or Avenue Road are quietest. 3. The hotel's complimentary bicycle valet program is an excellent amenity and the Don Valley Trails and Toronto Islands make excellent destinations for riders, as does the downtown core on weekends when traffic is quite light. I've made more than 20 trips to Toronto and love both the city and area surrounding the hotel, and I agree with the general tone of the reviews. I found the level of service to be absolutely outstanding, although I didn't find the property to harmonize well in visual terms. In going from my room to breakfast for example, the room had one theme, the hallway another, the ground lobby a third, and the breakfast room yet a fourth, with none of them top-of-class or particularly complementary. A small thing for sure, but a primary reason I found it just a tad short of expectations as a past Park Hyatt guest.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury stay”
Reviews.Author: roseguinea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hyatt for a leisurely trip to Toronto. The location is ideal....it is close to a subway stop, walkable to a lot of attractions. The service was great, especially the concierge. She helped up book a rental car for a day trip to Niagara Falls. It was so convenient. Finally, the rooms were clean and comfortable. The Park Hyatt really lived up to its name.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Yorkville”
Reviews.Author: bonniede
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our anniversary in an enhanced King room. It was large, very clean, well lite with a very comfortable bed, couch, coffee table and 2 chairs. The linens were good quality and plentiful. We faced north so not a great view but not too bad either. It was quiet and we slept well. The only thing we didn't like was not having a top sheet on the bed.
