There was just a comforter so we had to turn the air-conditioning up in order to get the room cool enough to sleep with a comforter. The TV was large and modern. The bathroom was large with lots of light and mirrors. The shower had plenty of hot water and good pressure. The room price was very reasonable for the excellent location. A complimentary newspaper was delivered to our door in the morning. It is on the corner of Bloor and Avenue road which is close to the great shopping and restaurants as well as the ROM and Gardner Museum. The service was excellent. There is complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby in the morning (only). I recommend the rooftop lounge for drinks and lunch - especially if the weather is good enough to sit on the balcony. I have been to the StilWater spa on a previous occasion with my daughter and we both liked it (massages) very much. Good valet parking - at a price($38+tax+tip). We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service, great rooms..”
Reviews.Author: ZrhWorldtraveller
Reviews.Content: The Park Hyatt I perfectly located in Yorkville â€“ great rooms, impeccable service and a wonderful fitness club SPA â€“ the rooftop location bar is just amazing , stay there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service/staff”
Reviews.Author: Lakers_8
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic in and of itself but the highlight was the front desk clerk Tony Valoroso. Was probably, hands down, the best staff member I've ever b\met in a hotel (and I've stayed in a lot of hotels). Upgraded the room and bent over backwards with every request.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable Service and Quality Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: cruzca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hyatt in July for a wedding. Without question, the rates can be pricey but the service and location are outstanding. If you look for deals you can find rates under $200/night. LOCATION: The location is within walking distance to the wonderfully chic Yorkville neighborhood, the Royal Ontario Museum and the University of Toronto. If you are in the mood to walk it is also within walking distance to the CN Tower and West Queen - but it would be better to take a metro to those locations. ROOMS: We stayed in a standard king room in the north tower. There are two different towers at the hotel and both have rooms that appear to have been former apartments in size (around 400 sq feet) and structure (unique angles and corner windows). The rooms were quite comfortable, with bedding that is outstanding and marble bathrooms that are very high-quality. They offer a twice-daily housekeeping service and the rooms are sparkling clean. SERVICES: We ate in the hotel restaurant, enjoyed the top floor bar and utilized the gym. The gym has a standard collection of treadmills, free weights and a few other machines. While it is small, everything was quality. It clearly served its purpose. It is located right next to the award-winning spa, which is a great way to walk into the gym. The top floor bar is a must visit - enjoy their tapas-style food and the great view. The hotel restaurant left a bit to be desired. It is pretty expensive and you can do better by simply walking to eat into the Yorkville neighborhood. The in-room wireless Internet was reliable, fast and free. TIPS: If you are planning on seeing the standard attractions in Toronto you really can avoid renting a car. At $40/day for parking at the hotel you can save a lot by either taking a cab ($45 from airport) or using their car service ($75 from airport). We used the car service and it was punctual and upscale. We walked a block from the hotel to the subway stop at the Metro and for $3 each way were able to take a comfortable ride to the CN Tower, Rodgers Centre and other locations. Additionally, consider eating out in the neighborhoods as the food at the hotel is very expensive. We found local restaurants that were half the cost for breakfast and less expensive for lunch/dinner as well. Additionally, utilize the concierge. We had wonderful help from them (they will mail your postcards for free and rent a car which we needed for a day trip to Niagara Falls). The car will be delivered to the hotel and you return to the hotel... hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel in a First Class Area”
Reviews.Author: MrEjection
Reviews.Content: If you have never been to Toronto and going with a significant other, this hotel and area is perfect. On the corner of Avenue and Bloor in the Yorkville district area of Toronto. The hotel was perfect for everything I needed. The room was very spacious and clean, the bed was very comfortable, the service was impeccable, free Wi-Fi was a nice touch, and the best thing about the hotel - the rooftop patio on the 18th floor, that overlooks Queens Circle and captures the skyline better than any other place I have been in the city. Watching the sunset on the patio with a glass of wine and my significant other was memorable. Everyone working at the hotel treated guests like royalty - I really cannot say enough good things about this hotel. The only real negatives on the hotel are parking ($38 + tax) per night, and the workout area was not great. However, there are so many places to run outside near the hotel. Besides the service and view of the skyline, the area of Yorkville is phenomenal. It is a boutique / upscale shopping area with some of the best restaurants in T.O. There is also a green line and a yellow line on the subway (TTC) within 1/4 mile of the hotel. There is a Morton's attached to the hotel and across from a Vera Wang boutique. Hemmingway's - my favorite bar in Toronto for sentimental reasons, is across the street from the Hotel. This hotel is about 3-5 subway stops from the heart of downtown, depending on where you want to go (CN Tower, Rogers Centre, Eaton Centre, etc.). Enjoy your stay in one of the most exciting cities in the world!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel to stay in toronto”
Reviews.Author: takama
Reviews.Content: good hotel, went for a free night, received well at reception, quick check in, directed to rooms, good rooms albeit small but with all amneties. good location for eating out and shopping. very nice and caring staff. great place to go again

Reviews.Title: “Professional Service and a more traditional hotel than Asian Park Hyatts”
Reviews.Author: jjkathome
Reviews.Content: Just completed a multiple night stay at the Park Hyatt. Booked a AAA rate for a Park Suite. The hotel is located in an older building, though it has been renovated. The Park Suite was a real suite but the bedroom was narrow and only fit a queen sized bed. As the building is older, the windows are smaller and gave the appearance of a relatively dark room. The room is well maintained, with more traditional looking furniture. It is not like any Asian Park Hyatt (ie Tokyo, Seoul). Service was professional, though a few minor inconveniences were noted (ie. housekeeping done fairly late in the afternoon, no newspapers delivered during the stay). The fitness room is located in the basement spa and was well equipped and not that busy. You have to pass through the spa to get to the gym. They have complimentary car service, but it is best to book in advance. And it has limited hours of operation. Also, location is in Yorkville. Some people may prefer this location as there are lots of shops and restaurants. But it is realistically a 20 minute walk to the CBD and a $10 cab ride. I would stay again if the rate was good and there was a good Hyatt promotion. However, for business, I would recommend places closer to the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Year after year, a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ksmithderm
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another wonderful weekend in Toronto. My wife and I stay at the Park Hyatt several times a year, and never fail to be pleased with the consistent top quality across the board: staff, rooms, ambience, quiet, gracious. An excellent example for other businesses. The Four Seasons and the Hazelton are very good, but we and our friends keep coming back to the Park Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Park Past its Prime”
Reviews.Author: monkeyface09
Reviews.Content: Perhaps it was once "the premier Toronto luxury hotel," but its current state is more of a has-been that's in denial. Rooms, while clean, are awkwardly decorated with upgraded furniture that's too big for the space and a washroom that's more gaudy old-school glamour than high-end modern luxury. Even more dated is their ridiculous voucher, yes, voucher system when your package includes breakfast...would it be that difficult, this day and age, to have all this info in one computerized system and simply ask guests to provide their room number? That being said, the breakfast is brilliant, especially the Sunday buffet option and the croissants could rival the boulangeries of Paris! I would come back just for breakfast but another night would only be considered with a sweet discount.

Reviews.Title: “Great ROM location, not a five-star”
Reviews.Author: Kirkberta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 3 children (ages 5, 8 and 12) in two connecting rooms in the North Tower. Rooms were pleasant and clean but dated. The shower had terrible pressure, as well as a water temperature problem. Also, the concierge staff--while completely pleasant--was a tad clueless. We usually stay in five-stars when we travel and this hotel is not in that class. You definitely wouldn't make a special trip to stay here or stay here to celebrate a special occasion. That said, if you have kids and you are in Toronto for the museums and restaurants, this is a great choice. It is right across the street from the Royal Ontario Museum (The ROM). Can't beat that. And it is either walking distance or a short taxi ride from a ton of great restaurants. The poutine on the room service menu is delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, staff can be iffy”
Reviews.Author: RiotActTK
Reviews.Content: August was my second stay at the Hyatt in recent years. The hotel itself and its amenities are fantastic. I stayed in the newer tower and the rooms were spacious, clean and the showers were excellent. The Roof Lounge is phenomenal. Despite all this, both stays have involved staff being confrontational, rude and downright hostile. For the most part, the staff is as good as every other aspect of the hotel, but I find it more than simply coincidence that I have had two separate incidents with the staff. The most recent incident was simply astonishing. My party and I were running late for a particular event that was integral to our stay in the city when our elevator became stuck between floors. After requesting help through the intercom and receiving a brief response, we were left without any contact for approx. 10-15 minutes while we became increasingly more anxious. Finally, we were able to open the doors ourselves. Remembering that most elevators have a safety feature that will not allow the elevator to move while the doors are open, we simply exited and dropped 3 feet to the next floor. On the way out of the building, we were met by a hostile security guard. Rather than apologizing for our delay and lack of contact or assistance, he proceeded to insult and scold us for exiting the elevator in plain view of other guests, further delaying us while we stood in shock at this display. I could understand his position that we could have been hurt, but the onus was on him to provide assistance and instruction. This is simply unacceptable behavior inside of a supposed 5-star hotel and put a damper on what was otherwise an enjoyable stay. Being called "stupid", amongst other adjectives, is certainly not part my idea of a pleasant stay. All that said, I look forward to staying at the Park Hyatt again. Hopefully any further misunderstandings with staff will be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: Jewellsverne
Reviews.Content: Fine service, excellent facilities and very pleasant rooms

Reviews.Title: “excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: rammenon
Reviews.Content: Recently popped in for 2 days on a business trip. Excellent rooms. The bar could be better and and closes early if you need to repair to the bar after dinner you need to go some place else. Check in is quick and efficient though a wee bit impersonal. Breakfast is good though it gets pretty crowded and probably not a good place to do a breakfast meeting. Overall good business hotel and efficient enough for the 1-2 day trip where you are in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Old School 5 Star Excellence”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 2 night stay at the Park Hyatt Toronto and could not fault it. While the location is not exactly the center of downtown it was perfect for our purposes. The hotel is two separate towers with a connecting lobby. "Old" and "New" tower. I stayed in the North or "Old" tower. Double upgrade to a junior suite, room a bit dated but well maintained. Needs flat screens and more modern shower fixtures but I am not complaining. Service was good with a few minor exceptions which were quickly remedied. The restaurant in the lobby is excellent, the Roof Bar a clubby (and expensive) spot for drinks and room service was very good.. The spa is very nice with high quality treatments and good fitness room. Minor hicccups with the GP points post stay but all in all I would recommend this as a true 5 star option in Toronto and will stay there when I am next in town. One word to the wise, the cab back to the airport is more expensive that a Town Car, book a car service for a flat rate.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent excellence”
Reviews.Author: wilson17
Reviews.Content: It has been too long since I stayed at a hotel where everything was perfect. The Park Hyatt combines new, high quality appearance with outstanding attention to details and service. Efficient friendly check in and check out. The room was spacious, with the expected large flat screen TV, comfortable king bed, well equipped bathroom (easy to control shower with good water pressure, ample thick towels, high quality soap, shampoo and lotion-basically all the details right). Importantly, WiFi was free, fast and had no problems. Location close to alot of interesting restaurants, but a bit far from downtown core. A great place for a meeting (not the cheapest, but I found it worth it!)

Reviews.Title: “the staff make this hotel feel like home”
Reviews.Author: bjr777
Reviews.Content: great stay, I was really well treated by all, I was to stay at another hotel but due to a mistake my reservation was not made. I was thrilled with the treatment they gave me at the Hyatt so on my next trip to Toronto I will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “5-stars says it all ;)”
Reviews.Author: SaraJaz
Reviews.Content: Park Hyatt room has made me feel so hOmie.... the bed is awesooooome.. the rooftop lounge is great too.... a great place to have a great stay ;)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not Park Hyatt's finest”
Reviews.Author: Gourmetphd
Reviews.Content: The Park Hyatt Toronto is located in the university neighborhood --nice place for a stroll, a little too far to walk if you need to go to the Convention Center/CN Tower attractions. The hotel is clean and comfortable, but feels more like a regular Hyatt than a "Park". The room was pretty standard, with a view on another building. The breakfast was very nice: excellent eggs benedict with spinach and salmon, served alongside fresh berries and housemade biscotti.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: septemberdude
Reviews.Content: We were new to Toronto and selected the Park Hyatt since we are familiar with the brand. We asked for and got a terrific room in the new tower. The older tower looked a bit worn and could use an update. Our bedroom was generous in size, bed was very comfortable, linens lovely, room location was quiet and service impeccable. Loved the lobby, conceirge was very helpful in arranging for the hotel car for us. Don't miss the roof-top bar - it's amazing. Met lots of locals there who come for drinks to share the incredible view.

Reviews.Title: “Park Hyatt as good as ever”
Reviews.Author: Cambridgtravler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in the Park Hyatt Toronto while bringing our son back to University of Toronto. We took a junior suite in case he decided to stay with us. The suite was lovely with two rooms, one with a king bed and one a living area with a sofa and large desk that my husband put to good use. There was also a small foyer. Both rooms had TV's. The bathroom was large, all marble with nice toiletries. One quibble here - why not a separate shower? I hate stepping into a bathtub, for fear of falling. The view over the city was fantastic. The windows actually open, which I love. Service is friendly although a requested bucket of ice took three phone calls. The location for us is perfect, walking distance to restaurants. The restaurant/bar on the top floor is wonderful, yummy hamburgers and the BEST mojitos I have ever had anywhere. This is my son's fourth year of university and I will miss the Park Hyatt when he graduates!

Reviews.Title: “MIxed Fellings This Time Around”
Reviews.Author: MTCB
Reviews.Content: While I still think this is a great property and would still recommend it, there are several issues I think guests need to aware of since central reservations does not give out the correct information. This hotel has either king or double beds- no queen size beds; so if travelling with family you probably don't want to stay here as double beds not adequate for more than one person. Other issue is that none of the rooms including suites(contrary to what central reservations will tell you) have pull out couches. So while I highly recommend this property for business travelers or romantic getaway for a couple I do not recommend for families- choose the Hyatt Regency instead which is better suited for families. Unfortunately even though our issue was caused by reservation misinformation, none of the check-in staff were empowered to provide an immediate resolution. Later when everyone was in bed we did get an offer for an additional room but it was already too late.

Reviews.Title: “great stay, great service”
Reviews.Author: mz15
Reviews.Content: we really enjoyed our stay at the park hyatt. great service here. rooms were very clean, and the hotel has a great location in yorkville area. we were definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good as expected”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Junkie_1109
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - feels pretty upcale. Shows a little wear and tear around the edges, but nicely aged. Roof bar definitely has a fantastic view, but a lot smaller and intimate than I expected. Location was great - near high end stores. Very close to metro station too.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4-star property but aspires to be 4.5-5 stars”
Reviews.Author: CatskillMountainMan
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent one night here and for the price we paid we thought we received excellent value. Booking through AmEx Platinum Travel Service, we got the Fine Hotels & Resorts rate of CAD 211.50/night which included continental breakfast for two, 4 p.m. checkout, an $85 hotel food credit, and a room upgrade. So, we got our money's worth. The public areas of the hotel are very nice. We had a Park Deluxe King room in the new tower on an upper floor. Room was enormous, very clean, tasteful but a bit dated and not arranged very well. The sofa in the room had seen better days, with lots of staining and discoloration--totatlly unacceptable in a hotel of this class. TV was an old 27" or 32" CRT and ought to be upgraded to an HD flat panel if the hotel wants to be taken seriously as a 4+ star property. Bed was very comfortable, albeit feather loaded so if you have feather allergies, you may want to special request a defeathered bedroom. Bathroom was lovely (shower head was perfectly fine--not sure what other are complaining about). The bathroom products provided (like shampoo, conditioner, moisturizer, bath gel) were very nice and in very large quantity containers--perfect for enjoying back at home. I found that most all staff at the hotel were courteous, friendly and helpful, even if many did seem like they were on the lookout for a gratuity whenever possible. We had dinner at the restaurant Annona. Food was very good, and they had a summer prix-fixe menu which was very reasonable. Service was a bit too intrusive to my liking, but it was still overall a good experience. The Yorkville location is wonderful. Parking at CAD 36/night is rather pricey but to be expected I suppose in this area with in/out privileges at a higher end hotel. This is a good property, but don't believe it really is up to Park Hyatt (i.e. 4.5-5 star) standards. As a 4-star property at a great price, though, it is a fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “Slowly and steadily declining in quality”
Reviews.Author: paestum70
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the PH Toronto now for more than 6 years with over 30 stays. The pluses are the generally comfortable rooms and the location. The Annona restaurant is also great. The previous post is very accurate...the shower heads need to go...they're horrible. The hotel however doesn't do a great job in terms of service. The concierge desk and front desk staff seem generally put-off and most requests are met with an icy return look. A genuine smile would go a long way. Now that there's more competition in the city I may forgo my Hyatt benefits and stay elsewhere (not once as a Hyatt Diamond member was I offered any special benefit...) This hotel is definitely one of the Park Hyatt's best. It's lost its appeal with me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Toronto Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlyOneWorld
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Park Hyatt for about 5 years. This property has so much to offer. The lobby is elegant and airy. The roof top, their bar, has striking city views and is my favorite place to unwind from a long day or to entertain guests. Breakfast at Ammona the on-site restaurant is always very good, kudos for the illy coffee! Mortons Steakhouse is in the building for a quick bar bite or drinks. Across from Mortons on Prince Arthur Ave is the Host for Indian food. Whole Foods is across the street down 2 blocks north. Truthfully, being in the heart of Toronto cannot be beat. Shopping, restaurants and bars are at your door. The rooms: The old tower has smaller rooms with simpler and older style bathrooms. That said the beds are very comfortable, sheets soft, the bath products are good, the internet is free (amen), turndown service gives you a bottled water/ice, and everything is comfortable albeit a tad small. In the Deluxe (new) tower rooms a large and very comfortable. Most have a seating area, a deep soaking tub and larger bathroom. The rooms here have a black/gold motif. Given the choice stay here. The Suites: Suites are mostly oversized rooms, I have stayed in a few that had separate sitting areas which were small. Truthfully, unless you have a compelling need for a suite a deluxe (new tower) room will suffice. A few issues: Soundproofing is ok but not perfect. Some rooms get street noise, others hallway noises. Valet parking is $36 CAD a night plus taxes which is understandable but still high. The Stillwater Spa in the hotel is very busy and hard to get appointments at. When you do get in, the spa is often crowded and I found the massage services pretty ordinary to poor. Perhaps go elsewhere. Given the location, high standards, and overall quality this Hyatt is among the best in the Hyatt chain and certainly in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: MyattMD
Reviews.Content: I may have reviewed this hotel before, but this time the experience was worth the price. I have stayed here previously and payed about $400 for a room. This time the price was about half that and I definitely got what I payed for. Front desk team was great and when I had a small issue with my door handle of my room it was fixed at the prearranged time. No problems with bright lights or noise at night. The parking is really expensive I find at 36 bucks a night. We'll probably return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New Years at the Park Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: RochesterSicilian
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Park Hyatt over New Year's. Very nice hotel! It has two towers -- one the original Park Hyatt is over 40 years old. The second tower is much newer. We stayed in the newer section in a two-room suite. Well equipped - except no coffee maker. Someone else commented that the bed linens are a little rough -- have to agree. Wonderful bar area on the top of the older tower -- classic! We found the drinks to be very expensive all over Toronto, and no exception here. $19 CAD for a Greygoose martini -- but maybe we're just spoiled in Rochester NY. The spa services are excellent!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hyatt in North America”
Reviews.Author: splatnz
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for 3 nights and booked through the Amex FHR programme in a Park Deluxe room. Have to say this is the best Hyatt I've stayed in in North America. Likes - Huge Room - Good range of bathroom amenities - Complimentary town car service that will take you within 5km of the hotel (we used it to goto dinner) - Very friendly, helpful and polite staff Dislikes - Very little, the shower head could be updated to something with a little more pressure Overall a fantastic hotel. We also had dinner at the restaurant and thoroughly enjoyed it. Will definitely stay here again when I'm in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Park Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Barry26
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the 1 night at the Park Hyatt this weekend. Excellent service upgraded my room to a junior suite. I would highly suggest this property. Spent a few hour at the Spa and dinner at Mortons all within the property. Thank you Hyatt

Reviews.Title: “Mostly great hotel”
Reviews.Author: raveman2001
Reviews.Content: Had a work conference at the hotel. At arrival check in was fast, staff just fine. I really liked my room, big , nice room, desk, chair, large bathroom and all amenities expected plus more except for coffee in the room. And an older tv. The food and staff at our meetings were great, that was good to see. The lack of coffee in the room was kind of annoying but there is free coffee in the lobby. All was well but I saw colleagues' rooms that were somewhat smaller than mine. If I would have paid the retail price I think I'd have to insist on a bigger room as it could vary by a couple of hundred square feet so try working that out upon reservation/checkin. Good area with nice restos, bars and sights on a quieter, upscale part of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: melachocolat
Reviews.Content: I had a really good stay here. Staff were friendly and helpful. The top floor terrace/bar has an excellent view, and you are in a very nice neighbourhood. Food was ok too and over all the hotel is good priced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: 5*fan
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. Yorkville, the Royal Ontario Museum, Bloor Street shopping and a metro station are all within easy walking distance. We have stayed at the nearby Four Seasons, and we found the Park Hyatt to be less dated. Our room was spacious, but bland and we were suprised to learn that we were in the updated wing. While the Park Hyatt may be one of the best hotels in Toronto right now, there is nothing spectacular about this property. I expect that when the Ritz and new Four Seasons are completed, they will have no problem diverting up market guests from the Park Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: sixnohit
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Hyatt for 5 days. It was quite a nice hotel. I had a deluxe room with a king sized bed, a sofa, a desk and what I call a mini foyer. The bathroom was almost as big as the actual room. Everything was great. I didn't eat at the hotel because I like to wander around and find local spots. Over Easy restaurant around the corner is a great place for breakfast. The only thing I didn't like about the hotel was that there was no ice machine even though there was an ice bucket in the room. I have a bad ankle that I have to ice every night so I had to keep calling the front desk to have a bag of ice delivered to my room. Other than that, everything was very nice. I don't know what that reviewer from Japan was talking about. This is a very nice hotel. If it weren't, then I don't think that major league baseball teams wouldn't be staying there when they're in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time”
Reviews.Author: SukiSuperGirl
Reviews.Content: Our stay at hotel Hyat was not what we expected. The surrounding ground outside was lovely, with a modern pool and bar area, however the interior of the hotel (reception area etc) was dated, though adequate. The corridors to hotel rooms were dark. Our room was very dated and smelt very musty and 'old'. the bathroom was windowless but adequate, though there wasn't always hot/warm water and the shower had no curtain so the bathroom ended up like a swimming pool. the was a lounge come bedroom in the middle of half of the room. Be aware!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Bay_Area_traveler_1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business convention. The rooms were very nice, but quite expensive (even on corporate rate). Did eat at the hotel restaurants, but just for convention catered meals, which were fine. One of the best things was the location - it allowed for some good walks to downtown stores, the surrounding neighborhoods, and the university (I did take an hour to tour the Egyptian museum right down the street) and access to the subway, etc.. Only issue I ran into was that the internet connection was broken for the 3 days I was there - they never got it fixed. FYI-this is the same issue for all hotels in the downtown - the distance to the airport is quite far - it took me a 30-45 minute cab ride to and from, so plan ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Park Hyatt !”
Reviews.Author: s786rizzo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Park Hyatt in Yorkville, Toronto for a short break for my birthday. It was a lovely place with attentive and very efficient service. On our arrival, they sent up complimentary champagne and chocolates for my birthday. The hotel itself was impressive and on dining in the restaurant for dinner, we found the service to be exemplary and the food delicious. It is well located, in the heart of Yorkville-which is considered a classy area to stay in. Lots of Starbucks and coffee places within walking distance of the hotel and the main shopping areas ( Eaton Centre and Queen Street West) were within walking distance of the hotel. Its also practically opposite to the Royal Ontario museum. We were very pleased with our stay here and would highly recommend it to anyone coming to stay in Toronto. No complaints at all!

Reviews.Title: “Who says a little age can't be nice?”
Reviews.Author: jimbofish8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Park Suite in the older tower of the two Pros: - Complimentary champagne and vanilla infused jam - Convenient location in Yorkville: a few hundred meters from the subway, whole foods, royal ontario museum - Above average service - Complete (and very prompt) in-room dining options - Connected to one of the better Spas - Stillwater Spa - in NA - Natural shampoos and lotion (wheat, flak seed, etc) - Complimentary internet access - "Older-style" hotel succeeds without being ultra modern Cons: - Anonna restaurant is inconveniently located in-between the two tours on the ground floor, meaning that lazy-morning breakfasts in the restaurant are not an option unless you want to walk past the front desk - No pants-press for business travelers - No light over the bathtub in a large bathroom making it quite dark - Price point for everything is a bit high, but perhaps to be expected of a park hyatt - Television system has not been updated to flat / lcd screen

Reviews.Title: “Classic Comfort in the Heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: ChinaExpat
Reviews.Content: Hello all. I am a Canadian expat working in China. I travel often and I recently chose the Park Hyatt in Toronto while I was there for a wedding. I read all the reviews on tripadvisor before booking the hotel and I must say that I was pleasantly surprised by my experience. First, as a Platinum Hyatt member i was upgraded to something in between an Executive King and a Suite, comfortable enough. Below is my review: This hotel is Park Hyatt elegance from top to bottom. The rooms are lovely, the bathrooms are incredible, and the Yorkville location make this an unbeatable experience. And just to top it off the service is excellent as well. To be honest, I don't have anything negative to say about this hotel experience. The televisions are a bit old but apart from that I couldn't be happier. I stay at the Park Hyatt every time I visit Toronto for work and I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else. A note, for those visitors who are not familiar with Toronto; the Park Hyatt is located in Yorkville which is a great nightlife and shopping district about 3 kilometers north of the financial district. So if you are coming in to Toronto for some work and you need to be downtown this might not be the best hotel for you, but if you like the uptown shopping experience than this is the neighborhood you need to be in. The location of the Park Hyatt is perfect. Also, be sure to book so that your stay includes breakfast, the restaurant on site has several tasty options. I hope that helps. China Expat

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, quiet hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: mattkc1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was perfect for quick business trip to Toronto. Staff was excellent -- friendly, quick. Room was very comfortable, excellent bed, perfect work area. In U of Toronto area -- easy to get a taxi, or the subway. Quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “Service does not match the setup”
Reviews.Author: shuy
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Park Hyatt Toronto two nights in January. On the date of check out, my check out portfolio showed 100 dollar charge from mini bar. We were there to audition my daughter at ballet school and my daughter was with us all the time. There is no way we use mini bar. I called front desk and lady from housekeeping checked the room. The lady had told us maybe it was previous customer. After one hour or so, screen portfolio will never been corrected, and we called front desk again. They said we should talk to housekeeping or room service direct and forwarded us. Then, room service department told us to talk to the front desk. When I called front desk, they said room service person checked the room and gin had been taken from the mini bar. I was so surprised and told them there is no way we consume alcohol because I do not drink and my daughter is teenage. They finally took charge off from our statement . But it sounds very unwilling and suspicious to us. No apology or any sort. It was very unpleasant experience. As a investment professional, I travel all over the world and use variety of hotels, however, it is one of worst experience and it is very rare while staying one of highest brand name hotels. Hotel was beautiful however it is very sad to see service staff does not match the setup.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustny
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fabulous location. Some really wonderful restaurants and shopping is within walking distance. The hotel is beautiful, and the rooms are spacious and extremely comfortable. The staff was extremely pleasant and very helpful. Will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: NettieandLewey
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hyatt partly because we'd had a fantastic experience at the Hyatt in Tokyo in April this year. The Toronto Hyatt was a different story. We stayed 4 nights. I'd requested a quiet room on a high floor - I got neither, in fact our room was directly opposite the elevator which had a noisy hard floor in front of it meaning every person who walked to it made a racket! My booking was for room and breakfast but on the first morning we were given a bill in the dining room. I queried it at the front desk and was told to disregard it and that they would 'keep an eye on the account' to ensure it didn't happen again. When we received the final bill all our breakfasts had been charged! So I had to go to the desk again, thus delaying our departure. The same guy I'd spoken to originally about this was there but didn't explain or apologise. The service in the room was not good - twice I had to request toilet paper and toiletries because none had been left!! Some days we got several towels, some days we got less. Compared to other Hyatts the room was rather shabby, the bathroom and TV were small and the cleanliness left a little to be desired. Major problem for me - why oh why don't they provide a coffee maker in the room - I do not want to be told I can get free coffee in the lobby every morning!! For the privilege of staying there and with this level of service I paid over $2000 CAD - Â£1014 GBP! I paid less than half this price for 4 nights in the Sheraton at Niagara Falls and 4 nights in the Hilton in Winnipeg - both excellent. Absolutely and totally not worth it -I expected more from Hyatt. My opinion - Toronto Hyatt is letting down the reputation of the Hyatt. Definitely not a 5 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Tries hard, but....”
Reviews.Author: Daoda2
Reviews.Content: I found the Park Hyatt Toronto to be typical off all the Park Hyatts I've stayed at. They're the Hyatt's attempt to be the equivalent of a Ritz or Four Seasons, but they don't quite make it. In the end, it's a good four-star hotel. The bed mattress and pillows were surprisingly hard, the sheets were rough. Small tube TV (I would expect a flat screen these days in any hotel of this caliber). The bathroom furnishings had an oddly cheap silver/gold motif. Not enough towels. Adequate gym. The spa looked nice, though the prices were very high. Concierge was helpful and gave us a good recommendation for an Indian restaurant. Location of hotel is excellent. No need to pay for valet parking--there are plenty of garages around the hotel at half the price. If the rate for a room at the Four Seasons is comparable, I'd stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service! Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ClearKate
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful stay at the Park Hyatt. The hotel is beautiful, location fantastic and sevice could not have been better. Since I am sensitive to noise I had requested a room high up and away from the elevator. They booked me into a gorgeous room on the 11th floor in the North Tower-- right opposite the elevator. When I said that the noise of the elevator would bother me they put me into a sixth floor room but unfortunately it was right above the entrance where cars come in and people register. I am a light sleeper and super sensitive to any noise. I had a very rough first night there but when I went down to complain the wonderful night staff--George and Michelle -thank you so much --upgraded me to a one bedroom suite (no extra charge) on the 12th floor of the South tower. My next three nights were quiet and stress free. I love the Park Hyatt and will definitely stay there again. All the staff I interacted with --front desk and concierge- were very friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. The rooms are big and luxurious, the beds super comfortable! And its only a 5 minute walk to Whole foods and perfectly placed for downtown and Yorkville shopping.

Reviews.Title: “A typical business hotel”
Reviews.Author: squirrelone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hyatt a couple of times last month. It is a typical business hotel with the same typical rooms as most other "higher end" business chains. The rooms were comfortable if not large, the bathrooms nice enough if not any "wow" component. The location is the best feature. My main issue was with the service which was hit and miss (more miss than hit) eg.: 1. The second stay my husband and I ended up in a twin bed room, when we called to try and change rooms they could only offer us a king room in the old smoking tower. I was probably more annoyed that they did not mention this at check in even though we were both standing together whilst checking in. 2. I called conceirge at one stage to find out if Toronto had a particular shoe store. Conceirge said they had never heard of it and so there must not be one. In hotels of a this class I would have expected them to check the phone directory or online for me and get back to me. I later found out that while there was no store the shoes I was looking for were sold at a couple of shops - a quick check online would have told them this. Would I stay here again, probably as it was perfectly functional and we got a good rate but it was not a memorable hotel which I think Park Hyatts should be. I did not try the Spa but have heard that it is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Service? What Service”
Reviews.Author: JMOsaka
Reviews.Content: Aside from the breakfast, which was pretty good, I was totally unimpressed with the Park Hyatt. The service was especially lacking. Felt like only the high-end users were treated in a good way. not us standard room types. Same old, same old mediocre North American chain hotel. The couple times we called to have something brought up to the room the item either didn't arrive or arrived 30 minutes later.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: Brendan8
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth trip to toronto, but first staying at the Park Hyatt Toronto. I was able to get a AAA rate for $179, which I thought was amazing. For being such a low rate i expected to get a room on the 2nd floor that was very tiny, the exact opposite was the case. The room was on the top floor and was a very good size. The beds were heavenly, and the bathroom was all marble with floor to ceiling mirrors. The service was outstanding. If you are able to make a trip up the the roof top lounge, the drinks might be expensive but the view makes up for it! The location at the corner of Bloor and University is amazing, a couple miles outside of the core, but in the trendy yorkville area. Yorkville is a little less crowded then downtown, but is covered in restaurants and high end boutique shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Park Hyatt - Good Times, Minor Bump.”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl29
Reviews.Content: Park Hyatt nearly gave me a heart attack the night before my wedding! Let's talk about one stress I didn't need...We booked our room a year in advance and even called the week before to confirm our non-smoking King. Lo & behold, upon check-in - they can't find our original reservation and try sticking us with (2) double beds. Because that's what I really want on my wedding night - a separate bed and LOTS of sleep. First we got the, "There's nothing we can do" routine and after some wrangling & manager-talking - we got what I suspect WAS a smoking room, sprayed out with a queen size bed, in a 1 bedroom suite - in a sold-out hotel during a busy weekend, no extra charge. THANK GOD! Other then that bump - the Hyatt ROCKED and loses a star from me based on poor organization. Room - LOTS of space, double sink vanity - all marble baby! Largest bathroom amenities I have ever seen - practically full-size bottles! Comfy bed, two TVs and a nicely stocked mini-bar. I think we were in the 'older' south tower, but it felt clean and new. The north tower is newer and just as nice (we toured the rooms before our wedding). Room Service - One of the BEST and most comprehensive menus I've seen. I think the prices were fair and in comparison to a nice meal out. I had the Lobster Club Sandwich with Fries for around $20. The Breakfast - $20 & The Grilled cheese $15. Good times all around, fast service. Parking - Around $30/day for valet, but worth it for the in/out priviliges. If you're willing to walk - you can park on the U of T grounds for around $14/day - but not for 24 hrs. like at the Hyatt. Spa - The BEST in Toronto, hands down. ipod menu/playlist given to you before your treatment. Classy tea lounge, whirlpool, steam room, sauna. Pricey - $140 for 60 minute massage. I would definitely stay here again! They resolved my problem and the service level is what you expect from a 5-star hotel. We paid around $300/night - so well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great view from 15th floor to south!”
Reviews.Author: Finnish_female
Reviews.Content: Hotel is big and high class, but the queen room in the older South tower was a bit small or maybe I should say poorly designed; lots of vain empty space near the entrance / bathroom which left only limited space to the room itself. Especially the bathroom was poorly designed: the door opened into the bathroom and when you wanted to us the toilet which was behind the door, you had to enter the bathroom and close the door to be able to walk to the toilet. The bathroom also had very limited desk space so at least I (female) had difficulties with keeping all my toiletries in the bathroom. The room was decorated in a slightly old fashined way, maybe a bit too decorative for my style. The room was clean and well kept twice a day, and the view was excellent. Minibar chocolates were not re-filled after consumption which was a bit odd. The hotel restaurants were expensive and during the congress that I was attending some people lost their wallets in the hotel from their handbags. At the same time Justin Timberlake and Jessica Biel were staying also at Park Hyatt so probably it is one of the best hotels in Toronto as celebrities choose it too. I personally might go for something more modern.

Reviews.Title: “sentimental favorite in need of some sparkle”
Reviews.Author: medulsa
Reviews.Content: I've spent A LOT of time staying in this hotel (on business) over the last 4 years and so it is a sentimental favorite of mine. The location is fantastic, right in the heart of Yorkville. The rooms are always clean and well kept. Anything that needs fixing is seen to straight away. The concierge is always fantastic, in fact it's just great to see familiar faces enduring over a long period of time. It says something about the hotel that they can encourage such loyalty. However, I have to say that after 4 years of the same decor, it's looking a little tired. I've also stayed in the Four Seasons across the road, and that has a lightness and airyness that I do prefer...however they don't have the loyalty program that the Hyatt does, so I tend not to choose them. If you like a more traditional hotel, with darker decor, this is the one for you. If your preference is towards something more modern and chic, go across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice And Quiet”
Reviews.Author: RestaurantLoverMB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 20 th 2007 weekend, the service the atmosphere, everything was just superb. The price of the room was very decent too, I would recommend this to any body who is a light sleeper as this is a nice quiet hotel. Thank you Park Hyatt

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: flyingpheonix
Reviews.Content: The Park Hyatt Toronto is a beautiful, well-located hotel with excellent restaurants and a phenomenal spa. The service was excellent. The room was decorated in a traditional style (in the South Tower) which I prefer to the newer rooms in the North Tower. The hotel is in a fabulous location located near shops, restaurants, museums and the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: BristolCarrot
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Toronto to meet some friends, we had meet on a chat room. We contacted the Hotel directly. When we arrived, the receptionist was polite. When we got to our room. I could not beleive the size of it, coming from the UK where the hotel rooms are small, it took my breath away. The room was clean, the house keepers turned the bed down every day. We decided to stay in the hotel that evening for dinner, the food was fantastic. We went up to the bar on the 18th floor the views even though dark was great. all in all it is the BEST hotel i have stayed in and we plan to stay at the park Hyatt again this year.

Reviews.Title: “Teflon hotel”
Reviews.Author: happycamperNewYork
Reviews.Content: This is the kind of hotel that is impervious to criticism because of the location. It will always attract business and convention travelers and can get away with bad service and tacky rooms. A dirty tray sat in the hallway for the entire length of my stay. And if you want abuse, the front desk staff is particularly nasty.

Reviews.Title: “Wedded Bliss”
Reviews.Author: Ken-and-Linda
Reviews.Content: Jan '06. 10 day stay occupying 1 junior suite and 1 twin room. This was not our 1st visit to Toronto or to the Park Hyatt so maybe it is a case of the more you get to know it, the more you get to love it. That is certainly the case with Toronto but also with this fine hotel. We were there for a family wedding and needed to call on the hotel's staff and facilities for a range of special requests for help with this and that. Everything was first class. Their people are professional of course but they are also courteous and friendly - they really make you feel at home The facilities, bars and restaurants are excellent. I heard someone remark that the 18th floor cocktail bar is too small and it is true that at times it is but it works because it is small if you understand my meaning. Guest rooms and suites are all nicely appointed with the most comfortable beds imaginable. Slightly more modern facilities in one tower over the other but we've stayed in both and frankly nothing much to choose between the two. Best central location in town - plenty to do nearby and train/taxi services from this area are excellent. Never found a business centre so take your laptop, but don't worry as nothing seems to be too much trouble for the concierge desk particularly ......... , no it would be wrong to single anyone out, they were all great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Boucher187
Reviews.Content: Great hotel overall. Staff was excellent. The entire building was in marvelous condition. You know you are staying at a great hotel when Justin Timberlake is there for 2 nights along with the Washington Wizards. Great work hotel for a tired American!

Reviews.Title: “Tried and True!”
Reviews.Author: Payam81
Reviews.Content: This hotel is strategically located in the heart of one of the hippest neighborhoods in city of Toronto. Accessibility to all of downtown core is provided via a constant supply of cabs or subway station 3 minutes away if you prefer. Overall my impressions of this place was just like every other Park Hyatt I've stayed at, a finely polished system designed to maximize guest comfort, and they have succeeded on my every stay. Rooms are nice decorated. Bathrooms are a tad small for my likes and general North American standards. Hotel building is from the 80's but has been extensively renovated, still the wood frame windows for example are relics of the past! Overall though it is extremely clean, quiet and well located. Fairly good value for the money. I highly recommend Park Hyatt Toronto if you want to have an enjoyable and predictable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Spectacular Experience in Every Way!”
Reviews.Author: DeborahToronto
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I are from Toronto and were married last weekend at the University of Toronto. We decided t o be 'tourists in our own city' and stayed at the Park Hyatt Hotel on our wedding weekend. Our out of town guests all stayed there as well. Our experience was extraordinary. I travel alot for business and have stayed in many beautiful hotels around the world - but found the Park Hyatt to be the loveliest hotel expperience I have ever had. Service was first class, our suite in the north tower luxurious and well laid out with a bed from heaven! Everything was very, very special. The food was excellent and spa services at the Stilllwater wonderful! It was truly perfect in every way , and added greatly to our special wedding weekend. We'll be recommending this hotel to others, and hopefully returning for as many 'tourists in our own city' experiences as possible at the Park Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,charming room”
Reviews.Author: glory4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a long weekend here the last week in August. The Park Hyatt is in a wonderful location right across the street from Vera Wang and some really cute cafes. The hotel really has a boutique feel once you get up into the rooms. We had a corner suite that had a beautiful view and one of the most amazing bathrooms we have ever seen in a hotel. The spa was nice, great treatments but a bad location under the hotel. The service in the hotel was adequate but not extraordinary in most instances. The exception to that was the restaurant which is perfection. They went out of their way to bring us our dessert in our room, after we were too tired to finish it. The food was amazing and the service top notch. We can't wait for an excuse to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: sdaj1993
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a night at the Park Hyatt in Toronto to celebrate our anniversary. We were not disappointed! This hotel is first class all the way. We stayed in the newer, north tower. We had a very spacious room with a king size bed. The bathroom was fantastic. Marble countertop, very spacious and a great lounging bathtub. There are also robes for your use hanging behind the door. The staff were very attentive and friendly, not snooty as read in other reviews. Went to dinner in trendy Yorkville then returned to the bar at the Hyatt on the 18th floor. This would be my only critisizm of the hotel. This lounge is great but very small. Had to wait a half hour to get in for a drink but well work the wait as the view was great. We plan on spending every anniversary at the Park Hyatt from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Relax in Yorkville in style!”
Reviews.Author: Tobie
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in other reviews, if you want a central location for tourist activities, particularly with children, then the Park Hyatt may not be for you. But if you aren't worried about that, or just want to spend time in Yorkville, then I can't recommend it enough. Our stay at the Hyatt was just for one overnight to see Spamalot and do some shopping and it was perfect..... We arrived in the rain to valet parking, a very friendly reservation staff and helpful concierge. After a few hours in traffic, all smiles were very much appreciated. Most of all we found our room to be lovely.....understated, but elegant. We stayed in 1531 in the north tower and thought the room provided the two of us with a great deal of space to relax, with a sofa, coffee table, chairs, and desk. The bathroom in marble, bath products and robes were all very welcoming, and everything was spotless and well lit. The king bed was very comfortable and the white linens crisp and fresh. Room service for a continental breakfast was nicely presented, and allowed us to relax with coffee while getting ready to leave for the day. They provide an pre-order option but it took only about 15 minutes for our order that morning. A cab downtown to the Canon Theatre (near the Eaton Centre) was $10 but considering parking fees and aggravation, was well worth it. We were able to take advantage of a special CAA offer of $199/night which did help to offset any transportation costs. But I have to say one of the highlights of the Hyatt for us would have to be the Roof Lounge with a beautiful view of the city and an intimate atmosphere. It was perfect for our anniversary! After staying in several hotels in Toronto over the years, we will most surely be back to stay at the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “stuffy”
Reviews.Author: dh24yaya
Reviews.Content: Last year my daughter and I stayed at the Park Hyatt in Chicago - the hotel was amazing...beautiful rooms with style and class - and the latest in technology. So we figured why not try the same hotel in Toronto.....not even close. The rooms were boring...walls basically baren; bed was very comfortable and bathroom was huge but nothing special. The lobby is also very business-like. Althought there is free internet connection in the room, if you need to check your emails, be prepared to pay $1/minute in the business center. We only ate in the restaurant for breakfast..food and service were impecable. Conceirge staff in very helpful and eager to please. It was just o.k....nothing special and at $380/night....I would have liked something a bit more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: KCS728
Reviews.Content: My husband, 7 year-old son, and I just returned from 3 nights at the Park Hyatt. The hotel is what you would generally expect from a Ritz or Four Seasons class hotel (it is not an ordinary Hyatt). If you are going to Toronto on business or to shop, this is perfect place. If you are going to do all of the touristy things, expect to take a lot of cabs or drive a lot, as it is about a $10 cab ride to the harborfront, CN tower, etc. We stayed in the North Tower, which is newer than the South Tower, but it does not have as good a view of the city. The room was really comfortably-sized. The bathroom was full of marble and granite, and it was well-laid out. The bed was exceptionally comfortable, with soft linens and fluffy pillows--I had some of my best nights' sleep on the road. The towels were also thick and oversized. The concierge was helpful in making reservations and giving us information, and the restaurant was good for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: hotelio
Reviews.Content: This is a very lovely hotel well located in Yorkville. The staff and service is excellent and the rooms are very comfortable and clean as you would expect. Our room was very pricey because we booked last minute during a city wide conference with very few rooms available anywhere in the city. My kids loved the homemade cookies and milk before bed. I am hard to please and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: sheraprincessofpowa
Reviews.Content: When I heard that my company was holding our meeting at the Park HYATT, I was a bit worried. I've stayed at some Hyatt properties and was always underwhelmed. This hotel was a complete surprise...definitely one of the best places I've stayed. We stayed here and held our meeting here. My room was on the top floor of the north tower, suite 1537. A huge room, with a sofa and two chairs. Two bath robes, a desk, a big - albeit Vegas-like bathroom. Extremely comfortable King size bed, big closet and free internet. The only thing missing was an in-room coffee maker. I ordered room service the first night. Had the blue nose sea bass with a green salad to start and it was delicious. This is also a good place to have a small meeting. We were in the Granite Room - it seated 10, and had no windows. When we arrived, the Executive Housekeeper gave us all his cards and told us to call him if we needed anything. The only caveat was the lack of housekeeping in the meeting room. We were in the room from 8 am until 6 pm and housekeeping did not come to clean or replenish the ice. The rooftop bar is amazing. One of the best views of Toronto I've ever seen. If you stay here, make sure to have a drink on the rooftop bar. The airconditioning broke in my room and when I called to inform them, someone was up within 5 minutes. I was told that the compressor broke. WIthin another 5 minutes a bellhop was there to escort me to my new room. At first they gave me a room that was a bit smaller than my original one and I expressed dissatisfaction. I was then moved to the exact same room I had, but a few floors down. Even with the small issues, this was a very comfortable room. Good, central location a few feet from Bloor Street, and I found the service to be exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PTD
Reviews.Content: Originally booked into Metropolitan but checked out after first night due to problems with the poor standard of the room & a cold breakfast. The Hyatt was great in every aspect, great rooms, great staff & excellent food. Concierge staff very good

Reviews.Title: “Be Aware: $50 for Early Checkout”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel very much. Superior to many other Hyatt properties. I was surprised, though, when I was charged $50 for checking out a day earlier than I had planned. Makes a certain amount of sense, but I've never run into that anywhere else. If you travel frequently for business as I do and your itinerary can chage from day to day, you might want to stay across the street at the Four Seasons and avoid the extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if in North Tower”
Reviews.Author: TravSmart
Reviews.Content: Park Hyatt is a fantastic Toronto hotel, both in accomodations and location. Be sure to get a room in the North tower. Seriously. If given a room in the South tower ask for a change - you will not be disappointed. The highlight of the South Tower is the 18th floor bar and its ever present bartender, Joe. Concierge was helpful, courtesy car available for short trips around town. Will be a repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, professional, very nice location”
Reviews.Author: aorrdalca
Reviews.Content: Cities with expensive real estate tend to have expensive hotels, and Toronto is no exception. This hotel reflects its city with well-apointed if smallish rooms. The sevice was uniformly excellent. The location was superb (how many hotels in Toronto, in all honesty, have the Royal Ontario Museum and a Rolls-Royce dealerships across the road?) All in all, we really enjoyed our stay here, and to those reviewers who've said, "stay somewhere else" I'd ask, "like where?"

HotelInfo.Name: Park Hyatt Toronto
